Title: Business Analyst - Data Strategy
Description:
¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un perfil dinámico que aporte de 2 a 3 años de experiencia en áreas analíticas preferiblemente con foco comercial y en áreas financieras o de riesgos. El candidato ideal será proactivo, analítico y colaborativo, con una destacada capacidad de comunicación y una visión crítica que le permita contribuir eficazmente al desarrollo de la organización.

Hablemos del proyecto...

El objetivo fundamental de este puesto es liderar el análisis y reporting de la red, asegurando una fluida transmisión de información y desarrollando estratégicas que impulsen el rendimiento comercial.

Responsabilidades Principales:

Análisis Avanzados y Benchmarks: Realizar análisis detallados y comparativos según las necesidades del negocio (analizar el resultado de las campañas y cómo mejorarlas,..).
Generación de Reportes Comerciales: Elaborar reportes mensuales para la dirección y la red, proporcionando información clave para la toma de decisiones.
Colaboración en Proyectos Transversales: Participar activamente en iniciativas interdepartamentales que contribuyan al logro de los objetivos organizacionales.
Apoyar de Sistemática y Formación: Establecer metodologías de trabajo y llevar a cabo formaciones que fortalezcan las competencias del equipo (identificar y difundir buenas prácticas comerciales,…).

Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con el Director de Inteligencia de Negocio y Directores Comerciales, interactuando con diversos departamentos del banco para fomentar un ambiente de colaboración y sinergia.

La compañía se encuentra en un proceso de transformación y gran crecimiento, lo que convierte a este puesto en un elemento clave para asegurar una transición exitosa y el alineamiento de la red con los objetivos estratégicos de la organización.

¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?

Experiencia en análisis de datos, capacidad demostrada en la realización de análisis complejos y presentación de resultados.
Que aportes formación en áreas como Ingeniería, Ciencia de Datos y Matemáticas o ADE, Económicas y cualquier rama Financiera junto alguna formación en Data.
Experto en Excel y PowerPoint.
Avanzado en analítica de datos (SQL, Python, Power BI, etc.).
Apreciamos la formación complementaria (máster o postgrado) relacionada, así como un buen nivel de inglés y conocimientos financieros.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At Amenitiz, we’re on a mission to simplify hospitality management, whether it's in the bustling streets of Paris or the serene Uyuni Salt Flats of Bolivia.

Empowering over 14,000 hoteliers worldwide, we’re more than just another SaaS scale-up—we’re revolutionizing one of the world’s oldest industries. With over $50 million raised from top-tier VCs who back disruptive giants like Alibaba, Toast, Zendesk, Delivery Hero, Revolut, and Loom, we've been recognized as a TravelTech Titan and one of Wired's hottest start-ups.

Our team, nearly 300 strong, is based in beautiful Barcelona. At Amenitiz, we cultivate a culture of positivity and personal growth. Our team members are enthusiastic, thrive on ownership, and excel in collaboration. Every day, we lead by example, prioritizing client satisfaction and executing with excellence. We are committed to making a positive impact wherever we go.

About the Role

At Amenitiz, we believe in the power of data to drive smart decisions, spark innovation, and improve the experience for our clients across the globe. As a Data Analyst Intern, you’ll be at the heart of that mission — working alongside experienced data professionals, product managers, and cross-functional teams to turn raw data into actionable insights.

This internship is designed for curious, analytical minds who are eager to learn and excited about using data to solve real-world problems. You’ll gain hands-on experience with our datasets, contribute to key projects, and grow your skills in data analytics, visualization, and product thinking.

Your mission:


Assist in gathering, cleaning, and analyzing data from multiple sources
Support the development and maintenance of dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, PowerBI, or Tableau
Help translate business questions into data queries and generate actionable insights
Collaborate with team members to track KPIs and visualize key operational metrics
Participate in the analysis of product usage and experiment results
Join team meetings and brainstorming sessions to understand how analytics informs decisions


What You'll Learn


How to structure and execute data analysis to support strategic decision-making
Best practices in data visualization, storytelling with data, and communicating to non-technical audiences
Fundamentals of statistical analysis, A/B testing, and experiment design
Practical experience using tools like SQL, Python (Pandas, Seaborn), and BI dashboards
Collaboration in cross-functional product and growth teams


Qualifications


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or a related field
Strong interest in data analysis and digital product development
Basic knowledge of SQL and/or Python (or a strong willingness to learn fast!)
Familiarity with Excel and/or data visualization tools is a plus
A proactive, curious mindset with strong attention to detail
Fluent in English, both spoken and written


If you’re a strategic thinker with a passion for driving growth and innovation, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and be a part of our exciting journey at Amenitiz!

If you’re a strategic thinker with a passion for driving growth and innovation, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and be a part of our exciting journey at Amenitiz!

Title: Master Data Intern
Description:
About The Job

Cada vez que comemos y bebemos, elegimos el mundo en el que queremos vivir. Creemos que la salud de las personas y del planeta están 100% interconectadas Esto es lo que transmite nuestra visión One Planet One Health. Os invitamos a uniros a nuestra revolución alimentaria con el objetivo de crear un mundo más saludable.

¿Te apasiona el área de Master Data? ¡Únete a nuestro Programa BTheOne y comienza tu andadura!

Tus principales funciones serán


Adquirir los conocimientos básicos del departamento de Master Data desarrollando la capacidad analítica, estratégica y aprendiendo herramientas de la función.
Ayudar a garantizar el mantenimiento de los datos maestros de Clientes para Iberia en MD.
Dar soporte en la coordinación con todos los actores implicados en estos procesos para asegurar la calidad de los datos, la consecución de los timmings marcados y la ejecución de la creación de los códigos en SAP.


About you

No dudes en aplicar si...


Has estudiado un grado en Administración de Empresas, o similar, y tienes interés por los datos.
Tienes nivel avanzado en Excel
Eres una persona orientada al detalle, con facilidad para relacionar conceptos y procesos y con capacidad para poder comunicar con otros departamentos
Dominas el inglés (mínimo B2).
Y sobre todo... tienes muchas ganas de aprender en una multinacional como Danone 🙂


About us

Trabajar en Danone te da la posibilidad de impactar en más de 12 millones de consumidores en España, donde lideramos el ranking de marcas más elegidas en el país.

En Danone trabajarás para hacer realidad una visión "One Planet, One Health" y no importa en qué posición estés para impactar en ella. Aquí tendrás espacio para crear, para emprender, para crecer y sobre todo para ser tú mismx, gracias a nuestra cultura de Diversidad Inclusiva, donde tenemos claro que "nuestras diferencias son las que marcan la diferencia".

Trabajarás con metodologías ágiles, en equipos de alto rendimiento donde aprenderás, influirás y aportarás para conseguir objetivos concretos y así crecer con la compañía.

Queremos que vengas y lo compruebes por ti mismo, pero si antes quieres tener más información haz click aquí para acabar de convencerte danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

En Danone estamos 100% comprometidos con garantizar procesos de selección libres de sesgos e igualdad de oportunidades. Para esto hemos formado a todas las personas que participan en ellos. Porque para trabajar con nosotros lo que nos importa es lo que tú puedes aportar y nada más.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst (MedTech Insights)
Description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Medtech group in Barcelona.

In this role, you will build MedTech therapy expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global MedTech customers. You will also actively develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

If you have passion for the dynamic MedTech landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


PhD in relevant subject area (science or business)
2-5 years of industry experience relating to quantitative data analysis
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions
Excellent read and written Spanish (Native or C2) and excellent read, spoken and written English (Native or C1/C2)


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience in building market forecast models and converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models
Relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors
Experience using SQL
You know how to deliver an effective presentation
Passionate about data and insights—you have the intrinsic drive to push boundaries on how we leverage data.
You appreciate the freedom to make an impact that you can own.
You are solution-oriented—you value ideas but understand the importance of execution.
Thrive in a rapidly changing business.
Respect deadlines and able to handle multiple projects at once.


What will you be doing in this role?


Author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets around the world.
Build market models by leveraging Clarivate’s proprietary healthcare datasets, while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
Engage in cross-functional collaboration on initiatives and projects impacting multiple teams.
Contribute your vision; influence the evolution of our products, data models, and data usage strategy.


About The Team

Clarivate's Medtech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions.

The Medtech Insights team, with members located in Canada, India, and Spain, is an essential part of the broader Medtech team's data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits


Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
30 working days of vacation.


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for a Healthcare Researcher & Data Analyst to join our Medtech group in Barcelona.

In this role, you will build MedTech therapy expertise and translate market research data into high-quality syndicated and custom insights to our global MedTech customers. You will also actively develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

If you have passion for the dynamic MedTech landscape and are excited about the opportunity to work in our vibrant Life Sciences & Healthcare (LS&H) group, we would like to hear from you.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

  • PhD in relevant subject area (science or business)
  • 2-5 years of industry experience relating to quantitative data analysis
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions
  • Excellent read and written Spanish (Native or C2) and excellent read, spoken and written English (Native or C1/C2)

It would be great if you also had . . .

  • Experience in building market forecast models and converting unstructured datasets into broadly usable data models
  • Relevant experience in the medical device, healthcare, market research or consulting sectors
  • Experience using SQL
  • You know how to deliver an effective presentation
  • Passionate about data and insights—you have the intrinsic drive to push boundaries on how we leverage data.
  • You appreciate the freedom to make an impact that you can own.
  • You are solution-oriented—you value ideas but understand the importance of execution.
  • Thrive in a rapidly changing business.
  • Respect deadlines and able to handle multiple projects at once.

What will you be doing in this role?

  • Author comprehensive market research reports that provide quantitative and qualitative insights on specific medical device markets around the world.
  • Build market models by leveraging Clarivate’s proprietary healthcare datasets, while incorporating public financial, regulatory, and government data.
  • Interview industry stakeholders and medical professionals to contextualize data and form insights.
  • Understand the worldview and pain points of Clarivate clients, working closely with them as a problem-solver. From Fortune 500 companies to smaller startups, you will converse with high-profile clients regularly and be expected to both present and defend conclusions to them.
  • Engage in cross-functional collaboration on initiatives and projects impacting multiple teams.
  • Contribute your vision; influence the evolution of our products, data models, and data usage strategy.

About The Team

Clarivate's Medtech Insights team harnesses real-world healthcare data, in-depth interviews, and our unique mix of in-house expertise to help medical device companies make some of their most important business decisions.

The Medtech Insights team, with members located in Canada, India, and Spain, is an essential part of the broader Medtech team's data-driven culture, and regularly contributes its subject matter expertise to other teams within the organization.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to our office in Barcelona (next to Sagrada Familia) 2-3 times per week.

Benefits

  • Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.
  • Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
  • Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).
  • Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).
  • Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).
  • 30 working days of vacation.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

As a Product Analyst, you will join ID Finance to support the development and optimization of the company’s products. You will focus on ensuring the effective operation of the legal and support teams while working to improve customer service processes, making them more data-driven and efficient.




Primary Responsibilities

Design, run, conclude AB tests in Product department.
Perform deep analysis of user metrics to find key points of growth or potential problems in user journeys.
Develop data-marts prototypes and analytical reports with key product indicators.
Automation and setup of analytical tools like appsflyer, google analytics and etc.




Knowledge & Skills

3+ years of relevant experience in similar role of Senior Product analyst in fintech/banking or e-commerce company
Strong background in statistics and AB design and analysis
Strong knowledge of SQL, preferably column-oriented DBMS
Experience with google analytics setup or working with similar platform.
Knowledge of modern mobile marketing attribution platforms like appsflyer and etc.
Fluent in English
High attention to detail and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, independent, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.




Nice to have:

Experience with Clickhouse DB
BI instruments like tableau, superset
Experience with airflow




Technological stack:

Clickhouse
Python
Git
Airflow
MySQL
Google cloud, google analytics, firebase
Appsflyer




Benefits

💪 Private health and dental insurance.

👟 Discounted gym membership.

💻 Freedom to work from home two days a week.

🍎 Kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Monday, Wednesday and Friday and snacks.

🌍 Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.




Don’t miss the opportunity to be part of a company that values innovation and talent!

Join us and take your career to the next level 🚀

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You´ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:Maintain and enhance an Excel-based tool, ensuring seamless integration with Databricks to automate data updates and improve efficiency.Improve data views and dashboards, making them more intuitive, insightful, and scalable for various stakeholders.Work on scalability solutions to expand the tool's functionality and adaptability across teams.Develop and automate reports and summaries, translating complex data into actionable insights for decision-making.Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, business teams, and stakeholders to ensure the tool meets business needs and evolves with changing requirements.Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.Provide documentation, training, and support to ensure end-users can effectively use the tool and reports. Required Qualifications:Expert-level proficiency in Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, macros, and VBAExpert-level proficiency in SQL for querying, data transformation, and analysisStrong experience with Databricks and other SQL-based platforms for large-scale data processing and analytics2+ years of experience in business analysis, data analysis, or a similar analytical roleProven track record of automating processes and improving data pipelines to drive efficiency and scalabilityStrong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detailExcellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teamsProficiency in Tableau for data visualization and dashboard development Preferred Qualifications:Experience with Python, SQL, or Spark for data manipulation and automation.Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.Familiarity with API integrations and data governance best practices.

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

• SQL advanced

• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

• AWS

• Microsoft Azure cloud computing

• Familiarity with DataOps principles

• Familiar with Agile methodologies

• Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

• You have good presentation skills.

• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Analyst / Engineer
Description:
Join our team as a Data Analyst at AXA Partners Barcelona!

Are you passionate about data analysis and want to be part of the transformation towards a data-driven company?

At AXA Partners, we are on an exciting journey to make data more relevant in strategic decision-making. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst who can actively contribute to our data strategy.

What will you do?

As a Data Analyst, you will be a key player in delivering rich and reliable data assets.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Developing and maintaining advanced analytical systems: Design, test, and deliver data assets that provide valuable insights for decision-making.
Ensuring the quality and sustainability of data assets: Implement quality routines and collaborate with experts to enhance our data platform.
Promoting the use of analytics within your team and the organization: Participate in data analysis projects, supporting the adoption of technologies and best practices.
Collaborating with the Data Analysts community: Share your knowledge and projects, and promote a culture of collaboration.


Your Profile

Profile We Are Looking For


Education: Master's degree in Business Intelligence with a specialization in Big Data.
Experience: 3-5 years in a production BI environment, with experience in data warehousing/analytics projects in multicultural organizations.
Technical skills:


Proficiency in BI tools (Power BI, SQL, SSAS, DAX, among others) and best practices in dimensional modeling.

Good understanding of the software development process (git, ci/cd, etc.) and knowledge in Azure DevOps is a plus.

Business Intelligence theory (dimensional modeling: Kimball, star schema, etc., database, data warehousing, datamarts, dimensional and tabular cube, KPI, etc.)


Languages: Fluent in English; French is a plus.
Agile mindset: Ability to work in an international and complex environment, with a focus on creativity and innovation.


AXA Partners is committed to diversity and inclusion, on an equal basis.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract).

Learn more about the Reforest Program here here.

About AXA

AXA Group is the world leader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients at every step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfy their needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and asset management. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 million clients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with a strong focus on risk prevention.

Our mission: Empower people to live a better life.

Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA.

About The Entity

AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection.

AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.

Combining passion with advanced expertise, we design and deliver worldwide solutions for partners and communities. We protect what matters, when it matters.

What We Offer

By joining AXA Partners, you will work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise & diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’s skills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation and opportunities for professional development and growth.

Additionally, at AXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happen and when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride is extraordinary.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD88025

Position Overview

Data is central to measuring all aspects of our business and critical to our growth. We’re looking for someone to join Autodesk’s Product Development & Manufacturing Services organization as a Sr. Data Analyst. Collaborate with business partners across Finance, Sales, Marketing and Product as a key member of our analytics team.

As a motivated self-starter you will be able to work in a fast paced, ambiguous environment. Proven attention to detail and an extensive eye for business will allow you to work efficiently with business partners across Finance, Sales, Product and Marketing to build business narratives and metrics for success. Additionally, you will define and test hypotheses, and deliver practical insights through data visualizations. You will succeed by having an eye on the big picture and challenge the status quo. Ask the hard questions to ensure investment of time and resources is warranted.

At Autodesk we value a hybrid work location culture. Remote work is supported within Germany, Ireland, Poland, and Spain. Additionally, if you live near one of our offices you are welcome to work there full or part-time based on your preference.

Responsibilities


Design and instrument key performance metrics, in partnership with the business growth and strategy teams. Deliver weekly and quarterly analysis of leading indicators and results
Define data model requirements that are scalable and focus on immediate business outcomes and results
Build self-serve tools and advanced visualizations that democratize access to data insights
Conduct in-depth ecosystem analyses that tell the story of what happened and how to improve
Improve internal process and stakeholder documentation guides


Minimum Qualifications


5+ years industry experience in data analytics / data visualization role, including 3+ years experience communicating analytical findings to executives. Experience includes metric dashboarding, storytelling, and presentation skills, and making recommendations based on data backed insights
Mastery of SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment
Mastery of data visualization software and design skills (PowerBI required; Looker or Tableau is a bonus)
Experience with data pipelines, ETL processes and a demonstrable understanding of database design principles (e.g. GitHub, DBT, Airflow, etc.)
Reporting experience across Sales, Marketing and Product (e.g. Salesforce, Marketo, Amplitude, etc.)
Degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with product analytics, clickstream datasets, or UX-related framework and tools


#AC-1

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Diversity & Belonging

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

Title: Operations Graduate
Description:
Teladoc Health is a leading company in telemedicine and virtual healthcare, providing digital health services, including online medical consultations, mental health therapy, chronic disease management, and overall wellness solutions. At Teladoc Health, we are revolutionizing access to healthcare with innovative telemedicine solutions. As we continue to increase our global reach and expand our ability to provide virtual care across the world, we are currently recruiting an Operations Analyst working from the Barcelona office.

Are you a tech-savvy Engineering Graduate eager to dive into real-world projects and leave your mark on the healthcare industry? Join our Operations team at Teladoc Health and work on innovative initiatives that help transform how people access and experience healthcare.

What You’ll Do

You’ll gain hands-on experience working on a variety of projects across different domains, such as:


Data analysis: Support projects by analyzing and interpreting data to generate insights and enhance our systems
System optimization: Collaborate on enhancing existing tools, platforms, or processes to improve efficiency and scalability
Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with diverse teams to solve complex challenges and deliver impactful results
Project Planning and Execution: Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation, to ensure successful delivery
Digital Transformation Leadership: Lead large-scale digital transformation initiatives, coordinating dedicated program and project teams to drive impactful changes
Professional Growth & Exposure: Work alongside experienced and talented professionals from companies such as McKinsey, BCG, and others


What We’re Looking For

We’d love to hear from you if you:


Have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (or are currently pursuing one) in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Are fluent in both Spanish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Possess excellent organizational and analytical abilities, with a resourceful and problem-solving mindset.
Are an effective communicator, capable of leading multidisciplinary teams and articulating complex ideas clearly.
Have strong interpersonal skills and a passion for building and maintaining long-term stakeholder relationships


How To Apply

Ready to take the next step? Send your CV and a brief cover letter explaining your interest in this position to miriam.cuartero@teladochealth.com

We look forward to welcoming you to our team and helping you grow, innovate, and succeed at Teladoc Health!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About FESTO: FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.




Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (sales, web analytics, marketing…).
Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Mentor and guide junior data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.
Conceptualize, follow up, and deliver analytics projects, including definition of KPIs, creation and communication of insights, and project definitions for junior analysts.




Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or business analytics role.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and technical leadership
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.




Not sure if this exact role is the perfect match for your profile?

No problem! We’re currently growing out our data and AI teams and looking at a variety of profiles. If you’re interested in working with us and feel your skills could be a good fit, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Title: Técnico/a Analytics
Description:
¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional en un entorno en constante evolución que apuesta por nuevas formas de trabajar en equipo? ¿Quieres apostar por una organización que es líder en su sector? ¿Te apetece pertenecer a una empresa dónde la diversidad del talento forma parte de nuestra cultura?¡Estás en el lugar ideal y en el momento oportuno!




Buscamos personas con ganas de innovar y de formar parte de la transformación de nuestro negocio. Queremos profesionales que conecten con nuestros valores Way, apasionados/as por el cliente y por conseguir los resultados, comprometidos la excelencia, con sentido de responsabilidad y del trabajo en equipo




En nuestra Compañía los qué son importantes y los cómo imprescindibles, y las personas son un referente para transformar nuestro negocio, actuando en línea con nuestros principios para dar valor a nuestros clientes.




Nos comprometemos a promover un entorno de trabajo inclusivo y diverso. Nuestra Política de Selección de Candidatos/as se basa en el principio de igualdad de oportunidades.




Valoramos la diversidad y creemos que cada persona aporta un conjunto único de habilidades y experiencias que enriquecen nuestro equipo.




En Servihabitat nos encontramos en búsqueda de un/a Técnico/a Analytics con ubicación en Cornellà de Llobregat con la misión de:

Garantizar la calidad, disponibilidad y análisis avanzado de los datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y operativas.
Automatizar procesos, desarrollar modelos analíticos y crear cuadros de mando (dashboards) que impulsen la eficiencia del negocio, utilizando tecnologías como Python, SQL, herramientas cloud y modelado con dbt.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Desarrollo Analítico y Visualización:

Crear y mantener cuadros de mando (dashboards) interactivos con herramientas como Power BI, Tableau.
Desarrollar informes y análisis ad-hoc para áreas de negocio.




¿Qué persona buscamos?

Conocimientos

Experiencia técnica:

- Más de 2 años en roles analíticos (Data Analyst, BI, Analytics Engineer).

- Dominio de SQL (consultas complejas, optimización) y Python (pandas, PySpark, automatización).

- Experiencia con herramientas de visualización (Power BI, Tableau, Metabase).

- Conocimiento en modelado de datos (dbt, ETL/ELT) y arquitecturas cloud (AWS/GCP/Azure).

- Valorable: conocimiento en IA/ML básico (ej.: modelos predictivos con scikit-learn).

- Experiencia en entornos ágiles: Trabajo con metodologías Scrum/Kanban y herramientas como Jira o Git.




Habilidades

- Análisis y Resolución de Problemas: Capacidad para interpretar datos y proponer soluciones accionables.

- Trabajo en Equipo: Colaboración con áreas como Oficina Técnica, Data Science o negocio.

- Capacidad para traducir necesidades de negocio en soluciones técnicas.

- Comunicación clara con equipos no técnicos.

- Gestión del Tiempo: Priorización de tareas en entornos ágiles (Scrum/Kanban).

- Adaptabilidad: Aprendizaje rápido de nuevas tecnologías y contextos de negocio.




Experiencia:

Desarrollo Analítico y Visualización:

- Crear y mantener cuadros de mando (dashboards) interactivos con herramientas como Power BI, Tableau.

- Desarrollar informes y análisis ad-hoc para áreas de negocio.

Show more

Title: Junior Supply Chain Data Analyst – September 2025
Description:
About You


You’ll graduate in 2025 and want to start your career in September 2025.
You see yourself thriving in the world of value chain transformation and are interested in how Technology, Business Processes, Data Analytics, and Change management create a flourishing ecosystem of solutions.
Above all, we believe in your potential:
You can demonstrate profound logical reasoning and you are resourceful in detailing solutions and considerate about their consequences.
You’re a team worker and player who can perform well without much supervision and who is committed to your own objectives.
You’re open to feedback and always look for ways to enhance collaboration.
You like to be challenged daily, show proactive ownership, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
You feel connected with and are ready to represent our company values: dig deep, own it, come together move fast and be kind!


Some hard skills:
You have that interest in Supply chain Processes and Data Analytics. Ideally, you have had an introduction to Supply chain processes in a minor or major within master’s degrees like business engineering, civil engineering – operational research/ data analytics or applied economics.
We consider any experience or proficiency in dashboard creation tools, such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc. a plus.
You are fluent in English and preferably Spanish. Mastery of any other language is a definite plus.
Willingness and eligibility to travel in and outside the EU and to work in a hybrid working model.

Why join us?

Well, a kickstart to your career through a 3-week training program, our Supply Chain boot camp in September in Belgium. You will learn the ins & outs of Supply Chain Management: Demand Planning, S&OP and Financial Planning, Supply Planning, Inventory Management, Master Data Management, Supply Chain Modeling and Planning Tools. This will allow you to onboard into our projects with a backpack full of expertise & skills!


Join a company at the forefront of global supply chain transformation with a new office in Barcelona — be part of this exciting expansion!
Leverage your expertise in a pioneering role, with the full support of our international team of experts to drive Barcelona’s success.
Be part of a global network spanning Belgium, the USA, Switzerland, Ireland, the Netherlands, Australia and Singapore—working on impactful international projects.
Travel opportunities to client sites, making your work truly international and engaging across borders.
Enjoy a workplace where personal and professional growth is prioritized—advance your career at your own pace.
We celebrate individuality, allowing you to thrive by being uniquely yourself.
Benefit from a competitive salary package, complete with multiple extra-legal perks designed to reward your expertise.


About Us

At Bluecrux, we transform supply chains into smart, efficient value chains through a blend of expert consulting and cutting-edge technology. We collaborate closely with industry leaders like Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Bridgestone, AkzoNobel, Beiersdorf, Oatly, and many more – creating partnerships that drive meaningful impact. With a global presence in Europe, the US and APAC, we’re committed to shaping the future of value chains, one success story at a time.

Within the plan squad, we have built up specific expertise in three main areas: Life sciences/pharma, CPG&CH and Chemicals&Industries. In these industries, we support a range of global leaders in their E2E planning transformation journey such as Bayer, Johnson&Johnson, BASF and Bridgestone.

During these E2E supply chain planning transformations, our experts support our customers in every step of their journey. We partner up to define a vision and review the operating model to create a strong and agile basis for the future.

The PLAN squad designs & implements our customers’ business transformation by defining the future organizational operating model, designing new ways of working & solutions advanced planning systems (APS), feeding their data factory, accelerating their setup towards agile S&OP or guiding them through their end-to-end supply chain planning. We do not work for them but rather with them, and we stand by their side the entire time. That is the only way to make changes stick and flourish.

Title: Checkout Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a Tech Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid). If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

Millions of customers every year across 44 markets – 5 brands – 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees – More than 60 different nationalities from all continents – 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world’s leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What You Will Do

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks


Build the infrastructure required for the extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Assemble large and complex datasets, with an optimal data pipeline architecture, meeting business requirements.
Implement processes to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Create alerts and dashboards to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs.
Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising queries, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Collaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed existing reports or create brand new reports with the aim to increase data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making across the organisation.
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects by participating in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support to the analytics and business teams when it comes to data availability and visualisation to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects.



What you need to succeed:

Good to have


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.).
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, data sets and workflow management tools (e.g. Airflow).
Advance knowledge of SQL is a requirement as well as experience working with databases and large sets of data; Python programming skills are also required as well as experience in data visualisation or exploration tools such as Looker Studio.
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail.
Strong organisational and communication skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English.



What’s In It For You

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.


Show more

What’s In It For You

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:

  • A rewarding Compensation package! 💥 Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
  • Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! 📚 Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
  • Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! 🚀 Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
  • Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! 💙 At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! 🎉 Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! 💫 Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Data Analyst – Teletrabajo híbrido
Description:
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Data Analyst en una en una empresa líder del sector transporte en un entorno colaborativo, jerarquía plana y con proyección laboral?




Desde Oxigent Technologies seleccionamos un/a ANALISTA DE DATOS cuya misión será dar sentido a los datos y transformarlos en información útil para la toma de decisiones de las áreas de negocio así como entender las necesidades del cliente interno y liderar dentro de su equipo de trabajo la creación de reportes y herramientas que mejor apoyen y ayuden en la visualización de la información.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?

Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.
Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información, teniendo una mirada crítica e impulsando las mejores prácticas del uso y consumo de datos.
Velar por el cumplimiento de los estándares de trabajo, procesos y correcta utilización de herramientas definidos desde el equipo de central de Business Insights, para asegurar procesos eficientes y escalables.




Para ello, ¿qué vas a necesitar?

Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería. Se valorará estudios de Máster/MBA.
Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos trabajando con Tableau.
Experiencia con lenguaje de consulta de datos (SQL) y/o Software estadisticos/matematicos (R, Python...)




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

• Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.

• Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (Hasta 46.000 euros brutos anuales).

• Horario flexible y jornada intensiva.

• Modelo híbrido (3 días remoto- 2 días en oficina) - Oficinas en Barcelona

• Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.

• Seguro médico privado.

• Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería y formación.

• Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.

• ¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

Show more

Title: Academic Data Analyst H/F
Description:
About EU Business School

EU Business School’s Barcelona campus is part of the EU Group—a network of professionally accredited, high-ranking business schools established in 1973. We offer foundation, bachelor's (BBA/BA/BS), and master's (MBA/MS) programs both online and on campus, providing a truly global learning environment.




About the Role

We are seeking a mid-level Academic Data & Student Records Officer to join our Academic Retention team in Barcelona. This role is pivotal in ensuring the accurate and timely enrolment of students throughout the academic year. The ideal candidate will collect, manage, and analyze student data throughout the entire academic journey—from enrolment to graduation—while contributing to retention initiatives through data insights and operational support.




Key Responsibilities

Serve as a liaison with the Accounting department to support payment and enrolment control processes.
Work closely with the Admissions team to verify enrolments across all study modalities (on campus, digital, virtual), including tracking late arrivals, postponements, and personalized study plans.
Coordinate with the Academic Department and student counsellors to validate attendance and access to the Learning Management System (LMS).
Support the IT team in issuing student credentials and ensuring a smooth onboarding process.
Analyze student data to identify trends and contribute to student retention strategies.
Maintain and regularly update student records and lists.
Assist in the development and monitoring of academic retention strategies.
Help prepare enrolment forecasts for upcoming academic terms.




About You

Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Experience working with databases and generating reports.
High level of computer literacy; able to extract data from various systems and create clear, actionable reports.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Power BI.
Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to meet deadlines in a dynamic environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Team-oriented, with the ability to thrive in a multicultural and collaborative setting.
Proactive mindset with a strong drive for continuous learning and improvement.




What We Offer

Permanent full-time contract.
One day of remote work per week.
Short working days on Fridays and during the summer.
Competitive salary, based on experience and qualifications.




How to Apply

Please send your CV

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Resumen del puesto

Desde la división de IT de WeHunt, estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con Tableau, en la zona de Catalunya para un cliente multinacional.




Descripción del puesto de trabajo

Trabajarás en un entorno tecnológico y en un proyecto a largo plazo que te garantiza estabilidad.
Experiencia en herramientas de visualización, pero que vaya más allá de solo diseñar dashboards
Visión crítica sobre la visualización de datos y que tenga la capacidad de evaluar migraciones o cambios, ofreciendo recomendaciones sobre la mejor forma de implementación y sus posibles impactos.
Liderarás la elaboración de informes para la posterior toma de decisiones, además de poder presentarlo a los equipos de negocio.
Buscamos un gestor de la herramienta, con un sólido conocimiento técnico.




Perfil buscado (H/M/D)

3-4 años de experiencia como Data Analyst (imprescindible)
Conocimientos sólidos en SQL, Tableau y/o Power BI.
Buen nivel de inglés hablado y escrito.




Qué ofrecemos

Modalidad de trabajo híbrida: 1 día en oficina y cuatro días en remoto a la semana.
Horario flexible, de lunes a jueves 8h, viernes 7h.
Jornada intensiva durante las vísperas de festivo y los meses de Julio y Agosto.
Contrato indefinido, con proyecto de larga duración.
Rango salarial competitivo (hasta 38.000€/anuales)




Siguientes pasos

El proceso contará con 2 fases:

Entrevista con el Responsable técnico de la empresa.
Entrevista con un compañero del equipo.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Partner Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners’ experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one.

THE JOURNEY


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes are operationalprocesses operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo’s partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Logistics Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
