Title: Analista de Datos Junior en Barcelona
Description:
Funciones:
- Extraer, recopilar, transformar y cargar datos (procesos ETL).
- Interpretar y analizar series de datos para obtener conclusiones basados en métricas.
- Crear reportes y dashboards para diferentes áreas del negocio.
- Automatizar tareas manuales y rutinarias.

Requisitos:
- Entre 1 a 3 años de experiencia en un puesto similar.
- Grado en matemática o ingeniería.
- Indispensable conocimientos en: SQL, R, procesos ETL, PowerBI y excel avanzado .
- Valorable Python e Inglés B2.

Se ofrece:
- Incorporación en una gran empresa, líder en su sector.
- Excelente ambiente laboral.
- Contrato: indefinido.
- Jornada flexible + día de teletrabajo + viernes de intensivo.
- Julio y agosto jornada intensiva de verano.
- Salario competitivo.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Story so far: Who we are




Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.




The Main Event: What you'll do 




Our Data team is at the heart of our decision-making, providing the insights and infrastructure to fuel growth and innovation. Join us to play a vital role in transforming data into actionable intelligence at Huspy!




You’ll join Huspy’s Data team as a Data Analyst with a focus on Business Intelligence, where you’ll support business units by delivering actionable insights and creating impactful reports. Your work will be crucial in helping teams make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and align with Huspy’s business objectives. You will take ownership of BI tools and dashboards, ensuring data quality and reliability for stakeholders across the organization.




Responsibilities:





Develop and Maintain BI Dashboards: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports in Tableau (preferred) or similar BI tools, ensuring they provide clear and actionable insights for business stakeholders.


Data Extraction and Analysis: Use SQL and other data extraction tools to gather, clean, and analyze data from various sources, including Snowflake.


Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with business, product, and engineering teams to understand their data needs, translating business questions into analytical requirements and solutions.


Optimize Reporting: Continuously enhance reporting systems for scalability and efficiency, ensuring reports are easy to access, interpret, and act upon.


Support Data-Driven Decisions: Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making and performance optimization.


Ensure Data Quality: Implement quality checks and maintain data accuracy across BI systems, working with data engineering to resolve any data issues.


Document BI Processes: Create and maintain documentation for BI processes, data definitions, and dashboard usage guidelines to support consistency and transparency.





The Perfect Match: What you bring





Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics). A Master’s degree is a plus.


Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analytics or BI-focused role.


BI and Visualization Expertise: Strong proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, or Looker, with the ability to create visually compelling and easy-to-navigate dashboards.


Technical Proficiency: Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation; familiarity with data platforms like Snowflake (preferred) is beneficial.


Data Analysis and Reporting Skills: Experience in conducting data analysis and generating insights to support business needs, including KPI tracking and performance reporting.


ETL Skills: Familiarity with ETL processes for data preparation, ensuring clean, accurate, and well-organized data for analysis.


Attention to Detail: Strong commitment to accuracy, with the ability to identify and correct data discrepancies.


Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Collaborative Spirit: Experience working cross-functionally, especially with product, engineering, and business teams to align data insights with business strategies.





What will set you apart





Experience with Our Tool Stack: Hands-on experience with Tableau, Snowflake, dbt, and Airflow is a strong plus.


Advanced Analytical Knowledge: Proficiency in Python or R for advanced data analysis and modeling.


Experience in Data-Driven Organizations: Previous experience in a fast-paced, data-centric environment where BI plays a strategic role in decision-making.


Business Acumen: Strong understanding of business processes, KPIs, and metrics relevant to the PropTech or startup sector.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Data Senior Analyst
Description:
Si eres un apasionado de los datos y estás buscando nuevos retos profesionales, tenemos una vacante de data senior analyst. Se trata de una posición híbrida en Barcelona, con 2 días de trabajo presencial y 3 días de home-office.




MISIÓN:




La misión del cargo es dar sentido a los datos y transformarlos en información útil para la toma de decisiones de las áreas de negocio. La persona deberá ser capaz de entender las necesidades del cliente interno y liderar dentro de su equipo de trabajo la creación de reportes y herramientas que mejor apoyen y ayuden en la visualización de la información. La persona debe ser capaz de proponer soluciones y mejoras al equipo de negocio, aportando valor con sus desarrollos que impulsen la mejora de resultados.




FUNCIONES:




∙Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos efectivas (diseño de sistemas, tableros,

gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos. dando sentido al flujo de análisis y

storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio. Uso avanzado de Tableau, Power BI o similar.

∙Liderar junto con su Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales o de

operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.

∙Apoyar a su Product Owner en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y

análisis de la información, teniendo una mirada crítica e impulsando las mejores prácticas del uso y

consumo de datos.




REQUISITOS:




∙Tener mínimo 3-4 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas

de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares (criterio excluyente).

∙Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería. Se

valorará estudios de Máster/MBA.

∙Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.

∙Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con varias áreas y stakeholders.

∙Pensamiento crítico y habilidades de Problem Solving: capacidad de entender un problema,

imaginar una solución y estructurarla.

∙Competencias profesionales: orientación a resultados, trabajo colaborativo. Iniciativa para la

innovación en la resolución de problemas.

∙Experiencia y solvencia con lenguajes de consulta de datos (p. ej., SQL).

∙Idiomas: Español e Inglés avanzado (deseable).




QUE OFRECEMOS:




Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




BCNC GROUP (https://bcncgroup.com/) es una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, UK, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Unimedia Technology, we're on the lookout for a Data Analyst to work on the next-gen digital signage and advertising platform used by major clients across Europe.




🎯 What You’ll Do

As a Data Specialist, you’ll be crucial to making sure the geographic and postal data is clean, accurate, and ready to go. Here's a taste of your day-to-day:

● 🌐 Research and scrape geographic, postal data and point-of-interest sources, integrating them into the systems.

● 🧹 Perform data cleaning, validation, and integration into our PostgreSQL database.

● 🧩 Collaborate on internal projects with the team to process and analyze data effectively.

● 🗺 Work closely with the Product Owner and Development to ensure data accuracy and relevance.

● 📝 Document your workflows and processes to keep things running smoothly.




🤹 You’ll Fit Right In If You...

● Have strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PostgreSQL (you’re comfortable writing queries like a pro).

● Know your way around data processing and automation (bonus if you’ve automated workflows before).

● Have excellent written and spoken English communication skills

● Hold a Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a relevant field.

● Have a good handling of Python or similar







💥 Nice-to-Haves

● Experience with GIS (Geographical Information Systems) tools like QGIS or similar platforms.

● Some familiarity with bash scripting and Git for version control.

● Hands-on knowledge of web scraping tools and techniques (because sometimes the best data is hiding on the web).

● A basic understanding of PHP (for occasional integrations).

● Fluency in additional languages, especially those useful in international postal systems.

Title: Data Analyst (Backend)
Description:
Title: Data Analyst (Backend)

Location: Barcelona

Contract type: Permanent Contract




Haybury are partnered with a global Biotech who are seeking a Data Analyst to support on backend data modelling using snowflake as a key tool to deliver accurate and precise data to key stakeholders.




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for delivering data modelling and structuring the data for key stakeholders alongside this you will have exposure and experience with large data loads.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain robust backend data models to support analytics and reporting needs
Create and optimize data structures for scalability, performance, and data integrity
Implement dimensional modeling techniques (snowflake) to support analytical use cases
Collaborate with data engineers to align data models with storage and pipeline strategies
Building semantic models to support dashboards or recurring analysis.
Creating strategic relationships with global stakeholders to deliver project insights




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data sciences or Data Management
3+years' Data Analysis experience
3+ years using Snowflake
Experience data modeling and handling large datasets
Pharmaceutical or Biotech experience is highly desired







Feel free to reach out to Rory.Pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential conversation or feel free to reach out via LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 55+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach data science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in product teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst who can dig into our complex databases, look for the root cause of a problem, and design their own solutions by writing code to implement them.

This is an opportunity to apply your skills while picking up new ones and delivering value for millions of customers around the world.

Up to shape the future of finance? Let's get in touch.

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets, modelling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Solid experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/university Olympic medal competitions in physics, maths, economics, or programming


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Senior Data Analyst (,)
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un/a Senior Data Analyst para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en el área de analítica promocional/análisis de ventas en importante empresa del sector Retail en Madrid.

Funciones


Analizar y sintetizar grandes volúmenes de datos utilizando herramientas como SQL (Snowflake), Python y Excel para extraer información valiosa que ayude en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Diseñar dashboards interactivos y reportes utilizando PowerBI y MicroStrategy, asegurando que los stakeholders accedan a información clara y relevante.
Implementar modelos de análisis estadístico, incluyendo estadística descriptiva y análisis de series temporales, específicamente en el sector Retail.
Trabajar con plataformas como Snowflake, PySpark y Snowpark para optimizar los procesos de análisis y mejorar la eficiencia en la gestión de datos.
Extraer, transformar y analizar datos en SQL
Traducir datos complejos en conclusiones claras y accionables
Identificar necesidades y requisitos colaborando con los distintos equipos de negocio (Compras, MKT, …)
Análisis del desempeño de promociones y campañas comerciales mediante seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs


Beneficios

En BETWEEN Creemos En Cuidar De Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecer Un Entorno Que Fomente Su Desarrollo Profesional. Por Ello, Te Ofrecemos


Seguro médico con Sanitas para garantizar tu bienestar y el de tu familia.
Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para ayudarte a continuar creciendo en tus áreas de interés.
Participación en una variedad de eventos sociales y de team building como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race, entre otros, que fomentan la cohesión y el trabajo en equipo.
Retribución flexible que incluye beneficios como comedores, transporte y guarderías, para que puedas organizar tu salario de la manera que mejor te convenga.
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento, reconociendo así la importancia de contar con un equipo diverso y capacitado.


Requisitos


Formación: Grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería
Conocimientos en estadística descriptiva y series temporales
Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.


Show more

  • Diseñar dashboards interactivos y reportes utilizando PowerBI y MicroStrategy, asegurando que los stakeholders accedan a información clara y relevante.
  • Implementar modelos de análisis estadístico, incluyendo estadística descriptiva y análisis de series temporales, específicamente en el sector Retail.
  • Trabajar con plataformas como Snowflake, PySpark y Snowpark para optimizar los procesos de análisis y mejorar la eficiencia en la gestión de datos.
  • Extraer, transformar y analizar datos en SQL
  • Traducir datos complejos en conclusiones claras y accionables
  • Identificar necesidades y requisitos colaborando con los distintos equipos de negocio (Compras, MKT, …)
  • Análisis del desempeño de promociones y campañas comerciales mediante seguimiento y evaluación de KPIs

Beneficios

En BETWEEN Creemos En Cuidar De Nuestros Empleados y Ofrecer Un Entorno Que Fomente Su Desarrollo Profesional. Por Ello, Te Ofrecemos

  • Seguro médico con Sanitas para garantizar tu bienestar y el de tu familia.
  • Oportunidades de formación en idiomas, certificaciones, bootcamps y mucho más, para ayudarte a continuar creciendo en tus áreas de interés.
  • Participación en una variedad de eventos sociales y de team building como BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race, entre otros, que fomentan la cohesión y el trabajo en equipo.
  • Retribución flexible que incluye beneficios como comedores, transporte y guarderías, para que puedas organizar tu salario de la manera que mejor te convenga.
  • Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento, reconociendo así la importancia de contar con un equipo diverso y capacitado.

Requisitos

  • Formación: Grado en Matemáticas, Física o Ingeniería
  • Conocimientos en estadística descriptiva y series temporales
  • Tecnologías requeridas: SQL (snowflake), Python, Excel, PowerBI, Azure Synapse.
  • Tecnologías deseables: PySpark, Snowpark, MicroStrategy
  • Muy valorable experiencia en sector Retail o proyectos de analítica promocional y análisis de ventas.

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist - Data Science (Openbank)
Description:
Country: Spain

Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!

Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.

You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.

You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.

To be successful in the role you must bring:


At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa Bárbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment. 

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here. 

#OPENBANK

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Manpowergroup Talent Solutions, estamos buscando un Data Analyst para incorporar en cliente final.




Nuestro cliente es un grupo multinacional industrial, líder en el mercado en su actividad, con un negocio consolidado y rentable, que por otra parte se encuentra en un interesante momento de transformación.




Misión del puesto:

Dar soporte a los diferentes principales clientes internos de la compañía en el análisis y la gestión del dato. Análisis de la información a partir de los datos existentes y obtención de insights relevantes que apoyen, de forma activa, la toma de decisiones de negocio.




Funciones y responsabilidades clave:

Responsable de consolidación de BBDD.
Creación de informes y dashboards que faciliten el análisis del performance de la compañía por parte de los diferentes departamentos y managers a los que dará soporte para servir de apoyo en la toma de decisiones.
Generación de análisis y propuesta de acciones.
Obtención de insights relevantes a partir del estudio, interconexión y análisis de la información existente.
Participación en proyectos relacionados con Inteligencia Artificial (IA).
Análisis y evaluación de las propuestas que se realizan.




Competencias Clave: (se realizará prueba práctica durante el proceso)

Capacidad analítica avanzada.

Excel: avanzado.

Power BI: avanzado.

SQL: avanzado.

SAP: deseable.

Salesforce: deseable.

Python: deseable.

Google Analytics: deseable.




Idiomas:

Español.

Inglés: mínimo B2, deseable C1




Experiencia:

≥ 3 años de experiencia gestionando datos y reporting.
Experiencia en generación de dashboards o cuadros de mandos para apoyar la toma de decisiones de negocio.
Deseable experiencia en contacto directo con equipos comerciales.




Perfil:

Analíticamente avanzado.
Autonomía y proactividad.
Visión del análisis desde las necesidades del cliente y el negocio.
Facilidad para el manejo de diferentes clientes internos en jerarquías de la organización.
Orientación a resultados y a generación de negocio.
Capacidad emprendedora y creativa.
Excelentes capacidades en la resolución de problemas.




Ubicación:

Sevilla




Modalidad:

Teletrabajo híbrido




Si te apasiona el análisis de datos, cuentas con experiencia en la creación de dashboards que transforman información en decisiones clave, y buscas un entorno dinámico en el que puedas crecer y desarrollar tu carrera, ¡queremos conocerte! ¡Postúlate ahora y da el siguiente paso en tu carrera profesional!

Title: Analista de datos Excel/PowerQuery
Description:
¿Estás buscando dar un nuevo paso en tu carrera? ¿Te consideras una persona proactiva capaz de liderar cambios en tu entorno? ¿Te interesa adentrarte en el mundo de la consultoría y trabajar para clientes en el ámbito nacional e internacional?




NTT DATA BPO, es una sociedad perteneciente al grupo NTT DATA, la cual presta servicios de externalización de procesos de negocio. Somos la sexta compañía de servicios IT del mundo lo que nos permite dar soluciones de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones tecnológicas, y outsourcing en diversas áreas. Trabajamos con grandes clientes en los sectores de telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




Somos una de las pocas compañías en España, con los estándares más altos de excelencia en las condiciones que ofrecemos a nuestros empleados, por eso estamos certificados como Top Employer desde 2016 hasta la actualidad. Apostamos por nuestros empleados y creemos por encima de todo en las personas y en su desarrollo integral, por lo que fomentamos un contexto de libertad responsable que se traduce en un alto rendimiento profesional.




Buscamos personas con conocimientos en análisis de datos financieros con Excel/PowerQuery para operadora de Telecomunicaciones atendiendo al segmento de clientes Wholesale de telecomunicaciones dentro del área de Carrier Services, cuyas funciones serán:




Seguimiento, control y consolidación de costes, ingresos y márgenes.
Seguimiento presupuestario y análisis de los desvíos.
Control y análisis de los principales KPIs del Negocio.
Coordinación de cierres contables mensuales y provisión de ingresos y costes.
Gestión de pedidos en SAP, así como de entradas de mercancía, ampliaciones...
Reportes forecast mensuales e información del estado de facturas.
Aseguramiento de facturación y provisión de ingresos y costes a través del reporte de negocio.
Cierre mensual y análisis de las desviaciones mensuales a través de la ejecución de tablas. dinámicas, cruce de datos y captura de datos en SAP.
Gestión de alta de nuevos proveedores y clientes.
Control de facturas: recepción, análisis, validación y seguimiento de pagos.
Resolución de incidencias y conciliación de facturas, con clientes y proveedores.
Gestión de la facturación de clientes y el registro de facturas de proveedores.
Seguimiento de provisiones para cumplir con los plazos marcados.
Control y seguimiento de cestas de proveedores (cestas, pedidos, vencimiento de contratos, aprobaciones).
Cálculo de provisiones mensuales por país.
Creación y reporte de cestas por proyectos.
Conciliación de cierres contables.
Prefacturación y proyecciones de cierre.
Revisión de incidencias referentes a pedidos pendientes de facturar, sobrepasados, incorrectos...
Elaboración de facturas y seguimiento de proyectos.
Revisión de ingresos contables y elaboración de informes para la línea de negocio.
Aclaración de reclamos de clientes y tramitación de rectificaciones.
Colaboración con otros departamentos como comercial, facturación, calidad del dato, y aseguramiento de ingreso.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Formar parte del equipo de profesionales de NTT DATA BPO, lo que significa que desde el primer día ponemos todos los mecanismos necesarios en funcionamiento para que tengas un plan de carrera y formación especializada para el desempeño de tus funciones profesionales:




Contrato Indefinido.
Plan de Carrera profesional en función de la formación, experiencia, potencial profesional y expectativas del candidato.
Formación desde el primer día dirigida a la especialización técnica y de transformación digital.
Salario en función de la experiencia del candidato.
Integrarte en una compañía multinacional líder (Una de las 10 compañías más grandes del sector a nivel mundial), joven y dinámica.
Formar parte de un ambiente creativo y colaborador donde puedes disfrutar de la experiencia del trabajo en equipo para lograr el máximo valor para nuestros clientes.
Trabajar en una empresa en constante evolución y crecimiento, realizando un trabajo enriquecedor con grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.




¿Te encaja? Esto es lo que valoramos:




Experiencia demostrable en Excel/PowerQuery.
Manejo avanzado de Excel (tablas dinámicas, cruce de datos, gráficas...)
Manejo avanzado de grandes volúmenes de datos, para cruzar diferentes fuentes y poder explotarlos.
Conocimientos de ETLs.
Buen manejo de herramientas informáticas y de reporting (Power BI, Power Query...).
Conocimiento de sistemas como SaleForce, Fast, SAP, Red, Adquira, SRM, y Gesnext.




Habilidades y competencias:




Capacidad para colaborar en equipos multidisciplinares e internacionales, como preventa, comercial, compras, etc.
Proactividad y autogestión del tiempo, para trabajar con autonomía y orientado a objetivos y resultados
Inglés fluido (B2)




En NTT DATA creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad. #WeAreAS #ApplicationServices #ProductDevelopment #ProductEvolution #Agile #Fullstack #Front #Back #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando 1 perfil de Data Analyst Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis Spain donde llevamos a cabo importantes proyectos de Inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura con clientes nacionales e internacionales, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS

Experiencia demostrable en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards.
Conocimientos sólidos en modelado de datos y lenguaje DAX.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales y consultas en SQL.
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights relevantes.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Valorable contar con certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.
Valorable contar con experiencia en herramientas de ETL y procesos de integración de datos.
Valorable contar con conocimientos en otras herramientas de visualización de datos.




RESPONSABILIDADES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para comprender los requisitos de negocio y traducirlos en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Optimizar modelos de datos y consultas para mejorar el rendimiento de los informes.
Garantizar la calidad y precisión de los datos presentados en los dashboards.
Proporcionar soporte y formación a usuarios finales sobre el uso de Power BI.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Analista de datos SQL/PowerBI
Description:
NTT DATA BPO, es una sociedad perteneciente al grupo NTT DATA, la cual presta servicios de externalización de procesos de negocio. NTT DATA es una consultora multinacional que ofrece soluciones de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones tecnológicas, y outsourcing. La compañía, desarrolla su actividad en los sectores de telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




Somos la sexta compañía de servicios IT del mundo, lo que nos permite dar soluciones y servicios en diversas áreas, aumentando las capacidades, recursos tecnológicos, geográficos y financieros de nuestros clientes, además de ayudarles dando las respuestas más innovadoras.




Somos una de las pocas compañías en España, con los estándares más altos de excelencia en las condiciones que ofrecemos a nuestros empleados, por eso estamos certificados como Top Employer desde 2016 hasta la actualidad. Apostamos por nuestros empleados y creemos por encima de todo en las personas y en su desarrollo integral, por lo que fomentamos un contexto de libertad responsable que se traduce en un alto rendimiento profesional.




Para nuestra oficina de Santander buscamos una persona con experiencia en análisis de datos y reporting, cuyas funciones serán:




Creación y mantenimiento de queries.
Desarrollo de informes en Power BI.
Desarrollo de ETLs en Python.




Conocimientos necesarios:




Conocimiento de bases de datos y modelos de datos PowerQuery/SQL.
Desarrollo de informes de Business Intelligence con PowerBI.
Experiencia en la explotación, análisis y construcción de reporting.
Desarrollo de consultas SQL optimizadas.
Valorable conocimientos de scripting en Python y experiencia en el desarrollo de ETLs con Python.




Te ofrecemos formar parte del equipo de profesionales de NTT DATA BPO , lo que significa que desde el primer día ponemos todos los mecanismos necesarios en funcionamiento para que tengas un plan de carrera y formación especializada para el desempeño de tus funciones profesionales:




Contrato Indefinido.
Plan de Carrera profesional en función de la formación, experiencia, potencial profesional y expectativas del candidato.
Formación desde el primer día dirigida a la especialización técnica y de transformación digital.
Salario en función de la experiencia del candidato.
Horario Lunes a Viernes en jornada flexible.
Modelo Híbrido.
Integrarte en una compañía multinacional líder (Una de las 10 compañías más grandes del sector a nivel mundial), joven y dinámica.
Formar parte de un ambiente creativo y colaborador donde puedes disfrutar de la experiencia del trabajo en equipo para lograr el máximo valor para nuestros clientes.
Trabajar en una empresa en constante evolución y crecimiento, realizando un trabajo enriquecedor con grandes oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Participación en proyectos innovadores y punteros para grandes clientes de primer nivel en distintos sectores de mercado.




Si eres una persona con buena comunicación, proactiva, que se sienta cómoda trabajando en equipo, no dudes en aplicar.

Title: Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel UCJC
Description:
La Universidad Camilo José Cela busca incorporar a un/a Analista de Datos/Contable con gran Dominio de Excel.

Funciones:

Análisis de datos y elaboración de informes detallados Gestión y depuración de bases de datos.
Creación de modelos y gráficos en Excel para representar datos de manera clara y visual.
Automatización de procesos y optimización de informes utilizando Excel.
Contabilidad de pequeñas empresas del grupo.

Requisitos:

Título universitario en áreas afines (contabilidad, matemáticas, economía u otros).
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en un puesto similar.
Inglés nivel medio.
Dominio de herramientas contables (Business Central) y Microsoft office (especialmente Excel nivel experto: funciones, tablas dinámicas, power Query y Power Pivot…)




Lugar habitual de trabajo: UCJC Villafranca

Tipo de contrato: Indefinido

Jornada completa

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo’s logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About ExoClick:




ExoClick is an innovative and global ad company serving 20 billion daily geo-targeted ads to web and mobile advertisers & publishers. We are part of EXOGROUP, a set of companies made up of +200 talents and offering a wide range of services within the digital business landscape with headquarters in Barcelona and offices in Dublin, Porto, Valencia, Tarragona, and Buenos Aires.




Role




As a Junior Data Analyst you will be part of the Analytics team at EXOGROUP, which is a highly skilled and qualified department that has diverse responsibilities.




Together with the Director of Analytics & Data Science and the Analytics team you will develop and maintain data reports that provide critical business visibility on key revenue and profit trends, by product, market, vertical and traffic sources. Additionally, you will collaborate with IT and Product teams to identify potential improvements in the platform by analysing and designing algorithms.




Tasks




Structure masses of information, identify data-driven trends and understand what really matters and why.
Collect KPIs and design/define visualizations.
Deliver insights and analytics across the company's operation and advertising departments.
Ability to identify and escalate issues and opportunities ahead of time helping to reduce impact and improve financial / performance implications.
Develop and maintain different internal applications and dashboards.
Together with the Analytics team, you will develop and promote actionable insights to increase the profitability of the company.




Skills




You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
You have programming experience in Python.
You are familiar with SQL and Git.
Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.
You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
You have programming experience in Python.
You are familiar with SQL and Git.
Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.




What you'll find working at ExoClick:




We offer a position in a young, dynamic and international team with exceptional working conditions in unique offices high up in the Torre Mapfre, one of Barcelona's world-renowned landmarks, located right on the city's seafront.

Additionally, we offer the opportunity for permanent training, personal development, ambitious career growth, and a competitive salary.




Most of all, we offer a position in a team that thrives on achievement, success, and leadership within our industry. Our core company value is innovation: where people and creativity drive innovative technology. If you have an innovative, winning mentality, this position is for you!




Our company benefits:




Flexitime and summer schedule;
Private health insurance;
Your Birthday off as a paid holiday;
Flexible compensation plan: travel, meals & childcare;
Additional internal and external training through our EXOGROUP University program;
English, Portuguese & Spanish classes;
training budget & study leave;
Employee referral program bonus - You can earn 2500Eur by referring someone!
Exciting team buildings in locations such as Ibiza;
Office games room/chill-out zone;
Organic fruit;
Wednesday team breakfast;
Yoga classes;
Massages;
Subsidized catering;
Flexible remote work;
Home office set up budget of 500 Eur;




Is this not the right role for you? Then make sure to check out all other roles we have open for you on our careers website.




The companies that are part of EXOGROUP are the data controllers regarding your personal data, in order to consider your application for present or future vacancies in our organization. For more information about the processing of your personal data and on how to exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation, portability and opposition please visit the Protection Informative Clause Candidates.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

MSX International Group is the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI’s deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

As Data Analyst the primary responsibility of this role will be manage and track requests related to lead management, IT reporting, and data analysis, acting as the key contact between different stakeholders, internal and externally.

Key Tasks


Manage and track requests made to external provider / system providers for Lead management, IT reporting topics, and data analysis.
Serve as a point of contact between the different stakeholders.
Coordinate the development and implementation of new solutions required by both the external and internal client with the provider.
Review lead numbers reflected in reporting platforms and ensure those figures accurately match reality.
Propose solutions to help correct errors in data reporting.
Participate in the development of solutions with AI functionalities, e.g., chatbots, knowledge database.


Qualifications


You possess a degree in a relevant field such as: IT, Computer Science, Information System, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or related fields.
Experience with Data & Integration.
Knowledge and experience about AI tools, predictions, statistics.
Experience with html.
You have a good level of English at least C1 is required.
You have strong interpersonal skills, you are open minded, you enjoy working in a Team environment and you possess excellent communication skills and excellent analytical skills.
You are proficient in MS Office365 applications.


Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

MSX International Group is the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI’s deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

As Data Analyst the primary responsibility of this role will be manage and track requests related to lead management, IT reporting, and data analysis, acting as the key contact between different stakeholders, internal and externally.

Key Tasks

  • Manage and track requests made to external provider / system providers for Lead management, IT reporting topics, and data analysis.
  • Serve as a point of contact between the different stakeholders.
  • Coordinate the development and implementation of new solutions required by both the external and internal client with the provider.
  • Review lead numbers reflected in reporting platforms and ensure those figures accurately match reality.
  • Propose solutions to help correct errors in data reporting.
  • Participate in the development of solutions with AI functionalities, e.g., chatbots, knowledge database.

Qualifications

  • You possess a degree in a relevant field such as: IT, Computer Science, Information System, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Business Analytics or related fields.
  • Experience with Data & Integration.
  • Knowledge and experience about AI tools, predictions, statistics.
  • Experience with html.
  • You have a good level of English at least C1 is required.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills, you are open minded, you enjoy working in a Team environment and you possess excellent communication skills and excellent analytical skills.
  • You are proficient in MS Office365 applications.

Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
🧠 Data Analyst

Ubicación: Madrid (formato híbrido)

Modalidad: Jornada completa | Contrato indefinido




🌟 Sobre el proyecto

En Brainy Commerce ayudamos a empresas a aprovechar todo el potencial de los grandes marketplaces como Amazon, Mercado Libre y Wallmart, Alibaba (Aliexpress, Miravia) y ahora también Tik Tok Shop, impulsando sus ventas locales e internacionales. Tenemos en marcha una herramienta digital que da visibilidad sobre el rendimiento, la publicidad y el mercado, integrando datos de múltiples fuentes en tiempo real.

Como analista de datos, serás parte fundamental en este proceso, ayudando a convertir datos complejos en insights accionables para nuestros equipos y nuestros clientes. Este puesto va mucho más allá de generar dashboards o paneles: buscamos un perfil analítico, curioso y orientado al negocio.







🎯 Tus responsabilidades

Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos relacionados con ventas, pricing, competencia, etc.
Diseñar y mantener dashboards interactivos en Power BI, que aporten valor a negocio y consultoría.
Colaborar estrechamente con los equipos de cuentas, data engineering y marketing para definir necesidades de reporting.
Proponer mejoras continuas en los modelos de análisis de datos.
Contribuir activamente en el diseño del producto desde la perspectiva de los datos.
Validar insights con stakeholders internos y clientes.







🧩 Lo que buscamos

1–2 años de experiencia como analista de datos o posición similar.
Conocimientos avanzados de Power BI (medidas DAX, modelado de datos, dashboards).
Capacidad para estructurar datos de distintas fuentes y generar reportes automáticos y eficientes.
Nivel intermedio en SQL.
Deseable: conocimientos básicos en Python, APIs, o herramientas de automatización de datos.
Deseable: experiencia previa en e-commerce, marketplaces o SaaS.







🧠 Perfil ideal

Te obsesiona entender el por qué detrás de los datos.
Te entusiasma contar historias con gráficos, no solo con números.
Tienes mentalidad de producto: entiendes cómo los datos impactan en decisiones reales.
Te gusta colaborar con otros perfiles (tech, negocio, marketing).
Eres organizado/a y sabes comunicar hallazgos complejos de forma clara.







🚀 Qué te ofrecemos

Participar en un proyecto con gran impacto en una empresa en crecimiento.
Formación continua en negocio, visualización, automatización y modelado de datos.
Oportunidades reales de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento horizontal.
Ambiente joven, colaborativo, muy orientado a la innovación.
Trabajo híbrido desde nuestra oficina en Plaza de España (Madrid).







¿Quieres sumarte a un equipo apasionado por la tecnología, los datos y los retos de negocio?

¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Data Analyst - Visualización & Negocio (Barcelona)
Description:
Únete a nosotros y forma parte del futuro de BCNC Group🚀




Somos una empresa de ingeniería y tecnología con operaciones en España, Reino Unido, Alemania, Francia y Suecia. Trabajamos con las multinacionales más prestigiosas de Europa ayudándoles a implementar sus proyectos estratégicos. #WeHaveOurOwnCode




🔍Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia en visualización de datos con enfoque en la generación de valor a negocio a través del análisis de datos trabajando codo a codo con las áreas estratégicas en una empresa referente del sector servicios con gran volumen de usuarios.




✨Qué harás en tu día a día:

Diseñar y construir dashboards claros, visuales y útiles que apoyen la toma de decisiones.
Generar storytelling con datos, facilitando la interpretación de la información para las áreas de negocio.
Colaborar de forma estrecha con el Product Owner y con los equipos comerciales y de operaciones, entendiendo sus procesos y retos.
Proponer mejoras y accionables a partir de los datos disponibles.
Promover buenas prácticas en el uso y consumo de la información, con mirada crítica y enfoque en la mejora continua.




✨Qué aspectos claves esperamos de ti:

Experiencia de al menos 3 años como analista de datos en proyectos recientes.
Dominio de herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Colaboración estrecha con equipos de negocio para comprender necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones visuales. Se valora capacidad analítica, sentido visual y orientación a la claridad en los datos.
Proactividad y orientación al impacto: no buscamos solo alguien que entregue dashboards, sino que aporte valor desde el análisis.
Trabajo en entornos ágiles (Scrum) y equipos multidisciplinares.




✨Que tenemos para ti:

🤝Contrato indefinido en una compañía de tecnología e ingeniería 100% digital.

👩‍💻Híbrido: 3 días de teletrabajo y 2 día a la semana en oficina.

⌚Flexibilidad real: Un horario flexible de entrada/salida para que seas tu quien gestione su tiempo de la manera más óptima.

✨Innovación: Proyectos retadores con tecnologías de vanguardia.

📖Formación: Un programa de formación personalizado y alineado en lo que más te apasione. Acceso a distintas plataformas educativas: Udemy, Openwebinars, entre otras que surjan a partir de tus necesidades e intereses.

🤩Desarrollo profesional: Un modelo de talento donde podrás evolucionar a través de la experiencia, logros y habilidades que irás adquiriendo dentro de BCNC Group.

🌴Vacaciones: contarás con 23 días laborables de vacaciones + 2 días (24 y 31 de diciembre por convenio) y porque no todo es trabajo, todos los viernes del año y verano (julio y agosto) de jornada intensiva.

🙌🏻Plan de referidos: Si, tus recomendaciones cuentan y cada vez que se incorpore a BCNC Group una persona que referencies recibirás una compensación económica por ello.




Y sobre todo… un buen entorno laboral: nuestros colaboradores puntúan un 4.7 sobre 5 su experiencia en BCNC Group!




Te queremos conocer...

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers’ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Data Analyst (m/f/*) In The EMEA DS Sales Excellence Team, You Will Have The Opportunity To Tap Into Your Curiosity And Collaborate With Some Of The Most Innovative And Diverse People Around The World. Here, You Will Make An Impact By


EMEA DS data analysis including internal data and external raw data to provide data-based insights to drive growth and increase share of wallet
Advanced Analytics: Perform complex data analysis using Power BI's DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query to deliver actionable insights
SQL Expertise: Write complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation. Work closely with data engineers to ensure efficient data pipelines are in place.
Snowflake Integration: Work with Snowflake databases for data storage, retrieval, and transformation. Optimize SQL queries to efficiently extract and manipulate data within Snowflake.
Power BI Security Model: Implement and manage Power BI security configurations such as row-level security (RLS) to ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Collaboration & Communication: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into actionable Power BI solutions.
Data Quality & Integrity: Ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data by performing data validation and quality checks.
Performance Optimization: Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for faster load times and overall better performance.
Documentation & Training: Create and maintain documentation for Power BI dashboards, data models, and security configurations. Train end-users on the use of Power BI reports and features.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
Profound experience in Power BI development and analytics
Profound experience in Power BI or BI Tool’s development with proven experience in building dashboards and reports from scratch
Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and related tools such as Power Query and DAX for advanced calculations
Experience with advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modeling, statistical analysis, or machine learning integration into Power BI
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience working with large data sets
Knowledge of data visualization best practices to ensure clarity and usability of reports and dashboards
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines


Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Diversity & Inclusion

(*) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, civil status, disability, family status, or membership of the travelling community.

Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.

Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of @solventum.com. Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the

terms.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Country: Portugal

Descrição Geral da Função

Apoiar a tomada de decisões estratégicas e operacionais relacionadas com Acompanhamento de Crédito, através da análise de dados, criação de dashboards e colaboração com diferentes stakeholders de negócio.

Principais Responsabilidades

  • Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (ex.: SAS e SQL Developer);
  • Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que dêem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
  • Analisar e interpretar dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
  • Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
  • Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes.

Requisitos

  • Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou similar;
  • Experiência relevante no negócio bancário;
  • Sólidos conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
  • Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
  • Bons conhcimentos de Inglês e valorizamos conhecimentos de Espanhol;
  • Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio;
  • Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas;
  • Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados;
  • Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders;
  • Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo.

Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE


Understand company requirements and define KPIs for dashboard development.
Collect, clean, and transform datasets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards for operational risk management.
Ensure agility in updating dashboards according to stakeholders' needs.
Continuously improve dashboard accuracy and usability by monitoring data quality.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Make recommendations to enhance dashboard production and data-driven decision-making.
Promote a data-driven culture within CIB by developing new data models.


YOUR PROFILE


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.Experience as a Data Analyst, specializing in dashboard development.
Proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, SQL, and ETL tools.
Experience with DataIKU.
Basic Python skills, preferably with Pandas.
Strong understanding of data visualization techniques.
Experience in Big Data technologies (PySpark, Presto, Airflow).
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX.
Familiarity with descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing.


What You'll Love About Working Here


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!
