Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

netum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023

Job Description

The purpose of this role is to provide data analysis and reporting tools for the VERDI team or assimilate (Compliance, top management, IG, Business) on an ad hoc and a regular basis using a variety of tools and programming skills.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing, and loading
Responsible for code and query optimization
Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost
Data Ingestion
Data processing
Data Quality
Support


Qualifications

Technical skills:


Advanced Python
Advanced SQL skills and relational database management (Oracle is Mandatory, SQL server is desirable, PostgreSQL is desirable )
PySpark
Git - (is a plus)
Experience with Data Warehouses
Experience with Parquet file format is a plus
Experience in creating APIs in Python is a plus
Apache Airflow - Experience in pipeline development is desirable
Agile methodologies (At least SCRUM)


Language Skills


Fluent in English (Mandatory)


Soft Skills


Good communication skills
Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same time
Team spirit
Client Focus
Adaptability skills
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we’re able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities

  • Collect and analyze business requirements to create reporting and data analysis solutions;
  • Design and develop data solutions (data warehouses, data marts, dashboards and reporting systems);
  • Create and maintain data models, reports and interactive visualizations;
  • Working in collaboration with IT teams to ensure effective data integration and management;
  • Helping business teams interpret insights and make data-driven decisions.

Essential Skills

  • At least 5 years experience in a similar role;
  • Solid experience in SQL for data analysis and extraction;
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or libraries such as matplotlib;
  • Knowledge of statistics and tools such as R or Python (pandas, NumPy, etc.);
  • Experience in the Pharma area is mandatory;
  • Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
  • Experience in data preparation and cleaning;
  • Good communication skills to share insights with multidisciplinary teams.
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Data Analyst - FP&A tool
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.



Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.





Job Description



As part of a larger Data Team, your primary responsibility will be managing our Unit4 FP&A tool alongside two colleagues. Unit4 FP&A is a comprehensive software solution designed to streamline financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analytical processes, helping organizations achieve optimal financial performance at a reduced cost.



You will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and modeling data, building reports and dashboards, and ensuring all outputs align with our business goals and financial objectives.



The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of business processes, system integration, and technical troubleshooting, while demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills with multiple stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities:



Analyze, identify, and resolve data quality and integrity issues with strong attention to detail.
Translate business requirements into data-driven solutions to improve financial operations.
Create, maintain, and enhance reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Unit4 FP&A.
Develop and maintain well-organized data models for efficient analysis.
Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow across systems and departments.
Provide technical support and training to end users while troubleshooting and resolving data or system issues.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Technology, Data Analytics).
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, including experience in complex database development, reporting, and automation.
Familiarity with CRM (preferably Dynamics CRM) and ERP systems. Expertise in Power BI or similar BI tools is a plus.
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent stakeholder management abilities.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Proficiency in cleaning, preprocessing, and organizing raw data.
Expertise in visualization tools like Power BI or similar.
Ability to create clear, insightful, and visually engaging reports, charts, and graphs.
Skilled in communicating complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient in database systems with the ability to write complex queries.
Experience working with relational and cloud data platforms (e.g., MS SQL, Snowflake).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating across departments.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to clearly convey findings.
Capability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
Strong prioritization skills to focus on the most critical analyses.
Ability to keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and financial reporting tools.
Proactive in seeking opportunities for skill development and technical advancements.
Adhering to data privacy regulations and upholding ethical standards in all aspects of data handling.

Office: Lisbon, expected onsite presence 2-3 days a week.





Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us.



At Unit4, we offer:



a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
Show more

  • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
  • a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams’ performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank’s assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets, we are leaders and we invest in innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast-growing business.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Credit Process Optimization team has been created in 2018 within Risk Personal Finance Global Credit Decision-making Policies, in Risk corporate teams. During first years, the team has realized numerous optimization projects, both on Fraud & Risk topics, and, capitalizing on them, has developed a first set of analytical modules to speed-up these projects locally.
This position is dedicated to support Germany’s local risk team by optimizing the fraud decision processes through an analytical approach. Responsibilities include analyzing fraud patterns, developing, and implementing measures to mitigate fraud and coordinating projects with both local and central stakeholders during the implementation of the new IT system. The main activities will be:
Contribute to the identification of optimization levers on risk & fraud decision process
Support the formalization and further development of effective strategies to manage and prevent fraud
Develop and optimize analyses and reports used to support management decisions
Define and modify necessary data sources and reports in collaboration with internal and external providers
Follow Risk & Fraud rules efficiency and find ways of optimizations through analytical methods and using our internal set of modules dedicated to optimization topics (RBO Toolkit)
Measure the added-value of each optimization project by the definition and valuation of key performance indicators
Provide contents for trainings to partners and employees
Maintain and optimize anti-fraud tools. Monitor their performance and prepare proposals to increase their effectiveness and efficiency
Advise internal stakeholders on fraud topics
Support communications departments in the procurement of contents that support internal and external partners in detecting and preventing fraud

The Mission is important, but working environment is also important!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments. You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.


What do we have to offer you?


The team is evolving in a strategic and challenging environment within Personal Finance and has interactions with different central and local directions. Working in an international environment, the Fraud Credit Process Optimization Data analyst develops his/her knowledge on local specificities: products, market, risk, ...


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, ideally in Fraud, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Have you monitored and analysed risk trends and/or fraud trends on applications and/or card payments and detect ways of optimization?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? German is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for …
We look forward to your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department
Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and within specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department
There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data
An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key
Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc
The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions
The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master’s Degree in Finance / Mathematics / Science / Engineering or related
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant data analysis field
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Client focused
Organisational skills
Proactivity


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Internal Auditor - Data Analyst New Joiners
Description:
The Risk Assurance Services area of PwC is dedicated to the analysis and management of business risks, helping organizations strengthen their governance, optimize processes, and comply with regulations. Its objective is to provide security and confidence to stakeholders through audits, evaluation of internal controls, and the use of technology to minimize risks.

In this team, you will deal with complex business challenges and outline strategies for our clients in Portugal and internationally, using technology and data analysis to increase security and optimize the efficiency of companies' processes.

Integrated into the Risk Assurance team, the professional to be hired will have the following main responsibilities:


Conduct internal audits and risk assessments for clients from different sectors
Analyze and optimize processes, ensuring compliance with regulations and best practices
Support the implementation and improvement of internal control systems and corporate governance
Work with data analysis and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of audit processes
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop customized solutions for clients


Curious?

Can you already imagine being part of our Community?

Requirements

If you are convinced that this opportunity is for you, then you just need to make sure you meet the following requirements - take a look:


Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Management, Economics, Finance, or similar areas
Interest in Internal Audit, Internal Control, Data Analysis, and process optimization
Analytical skills, attention to detail, and critical thinking
Dynamism and strong team spirit
Capacity for learning
Responsible and resilient
Fluency in Portuguese (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of English (spoken and written)


If, like us, you believe that the success of PwC lies in the essence of People and their authenticity, dynamism, and willingness to go "beyond," then… you have found your "world".

It's time to apply - we want you to be part of the "Team PwC"!

Title: Data Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner…), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills – oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees’ needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF’s RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank’s credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines – LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF’s RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
  • Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
  • Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data

Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team

  • Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
  • Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.

Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process

  • Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
  • Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
  • Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • 2/3 years of experience in same or related field
  • Data knowledge
  • Risk analysis
  • Culture Transformation Change Management
  • Process improvement
  • Project management
  • Active collaboration
  • Adaptability
  • English (mandatory): fluent
  • French (recommended): Operational

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Customer Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Ready to lead, disrupt and reinvent the sleep industry?

We are Emma – The Sleep Company. Founded in 2015, we’ve become the world’s largest D2C sleep brand, available in over 35 countries with more than 25 stores across Europe. Recommended by leading consumer associations in EMEA, APAC, and the Americas, we develop the best sleep comfort products that empower our customers to awaken their best every day.

At Emma, we are a community of smart, driven people, united by a strong culture of collaboration, teamwork, and knowledge sharing. We think big, take ownership, and are empowered to drive meaningful impact. Through hands-on experience, mentorship, and continuous learning, we drive our own growth and learning. With Emmies from over 60 nationalities and offices across multiple regions, our diverse perspectives enrich our workplace culture. Ready to shape the future of sleep with us? Let’s make it happen!

What You'll Do


Transform Customer Data into Action: Analyze customer journey data to generate actionable insights that improve customer experience (CSAT, NPS, contact rate).
Develop Reporting Solutions: Own the design, development, and maintenance of dashboards and reports for the Customer Excellence team.
Data-Driven Decision Support: Translate customer experience challenges into analytical approaches, identifying opportunities for improvement in processes and support.
Own CX Reporting: Manage the entire reporting process, ensuring consistent, reliable, and timely delivery of insights to stakeholders.
Create Impactful Visualizations: Build intuitive and effective dashboards in Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with Customer Service, Product Tech, and Operations teams to ensure insights align with business goals and improve the overall customer journey.
Improve Data Infrastructure: Contribute to data modeling and the optimization of ETL pipelines specific to Customer Excellence needs.



Who We Are Looking For


Experience: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in customer experience or support contexts.
SQL Expertise: Proficient in SQL (Redshift, Oracle, or similar databases).
Customer Metrics Knowledge: Strong understanding of Customer Experience metrics (CSAT, NPS, CES, etc.).
Data Visualization Skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Quicksight.
Autonomous Analyst: Ability to manage end-to-end data processes with minimal supervision.
ETL & Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling and building ETL pipelines.
Python for Data: Python scripting experience for data manipulation is a plus.
Statistical Tools: Familiarity with R, SAS, or Matlab is valued.
Proactive & Solution-Oriented: Strong problem-solving mindset with the ability to turn complex data into clear insights.



What We Offer


Pet-friendly environment, where you can bring your furry desk buddy;
Discounts on our top-notch products;
Health insurance including dentist;
24 days holidays / year +1 day/year at Emma (máx. 29 days);
The opportunity to collaborate with multinational teams;
Exciting events that aren't just team-building exercises but opportunities to create epic memories;
All the tools you need to grow and ownership from the beginning.



Become an Emmie

Emma is transforming the world of sleep - and we want the highest-performing people to help us pull it off. We want you. But only if you're willing to go all in. Only if you're willing to question, disrupt, innovate, and create from the ground up.

We proudly celebrate diversity. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting inclusion in our workplace. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, ethnic origin, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age.

Our aim is to get back to you in a couple of days, however, we are currently receiving a large number of applications and this might lead to a delay in the process. We will get back to you as soon as possible!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Main tasks:


Analyses, plans, implements and technically tests IT solutions in the context of projects within the scope of the DataWarehouse.
Ensures the formalization and ensures that documentation is completed in accordance with current procedures.
Occasionally participates in meetings with the Business Areas and in working sessions with the team responsible for functional definition, carrying out certification/quality tests and monitoring UAT tests.
Proposes improvements to management platforms and tools, with the aim of optimizing and innovating them.
Formalize and documents the technical analyses it carries out, the technical solutions it implements, the technical tests it performs and the decision-making meetings it participates in.
Communicates and validates its activities and decisions with the person in charge, thus ensuring that they are aligned with the department's recommendations in terms of posture and Roadmap.
Reports to the Data Hub Chapter.


Qualifications

Technical Skills:


Knowledge of programming Microsoft BI Tolls
SQL/T-SQL
Power Bi
Jira/Confluence/ Draw IO
Knowledge of applications from a user perspective: MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or similar areas.
Experience in Datawarehouse solutions, with an understanding of all phases of construction.
Minimum of 6 years of experience in functional/technical analysis and definition of corporate data models.
Analytical skills and clear skills for conceptual designs that respond transversally to the Datawarehouse.
Experience in projects/environments with Agile framework.
Preference for experience in models with Data Vault methodology.
Preference for experience in the Banking area (consumer credit)


Language Skills


Portuguese
English


Additional Information

Soft skills:

Strong communication and organizational skills

Ability to gather requirements, document and lead meetings

Autonomy and proactivity. Critical thinking

Ability to synthesize and solve problems. Adaptability and resilience

Focus on the customer and delivering results
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Na IRIUM queremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos!Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura de

Data Analyst

Requisitos: Acompanhar a performance das nossas estratégias de prevenção de fraude nos diversos produtos, serviços e geografias monitorizados Monitorizar a performance de modelos e regras de prevenção de fraude, garantindo a sua relevância na contenção de eventos e padrões de fraude ativos Trabalhar com os nossos Data Scientists para entregar uma performance e otimização de topo dos nossos modelos de ML Trabalhar com a nossa equipa de operações de prevenção de fraude no ajuste e desenvolvimento de modelos Desenhar, testar e implementar regras e features de profiling recorrendo a metodologias analíticas e estatísticas Trabalhar com a nossa equipa de negócio na resposta a pedidos de cliente, através de análises ad-hoc, desenho e simulação regras, garantindo o sucesso destas implementações Desafiar os atuais processos e estratégias de prevenção de fraude, promovendo soluções industrializáveis e de atuação automatizada Identificar novas fontes de dados que permitam adicionar valor ao nosso data lake Atuar como especialista de fraude em equipas de projeto multidisciplinares e garantir que novos produtos e serviços estão alinhados com as melhores práticas e políticas de antifraude Requisitos obrigatórios: Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Eletrotécnica, Estatística,Matemática Aplicada, ou similar Experiência em funções analíticas Excelente capacidade de resolução de problemas Proficiência em Python e SQL Conhecimentos de PowerBI e Excel Requisitos desejaveis: Experiência com Databricks é valorizada Conhecimentos de algoritmos de Machine Learning (e.g.Random Forest, XGBoost,LGBM) e tecnologias Big Data como (Spark, Hadoop) são valorizados Experiência em deteção de fraude será valorizada Localização: Alfragide

Regime

Hibrido 3x no escritório.O que oferecemos?

Uma empresa inovadora e em crescimento, com muitas oportunidades de desenvolvimento profissional.Retribuição de acordo com a tua experiência e performance.Acesso a retribuição flexível e seguro médico como benefício social.Acesso ilimitado a formação tecnológica em modalidade livre.

A IRIUM é uma empresa formada por profissionais dinâmicos e proativos.Os nossos valores são a responsabilidade e o compromisso com a qualidade do trabalho.Este é o espírito que procuramos na IRIUM, seja qual for a tua idade.Se te reconheces nestes valores, esta é a tua empresa!Podemos construir juntos o futuro.Falamos?

Envie a tua candidatura para: ****** Na IRIUM defendemos um mundo sem estereótipos nem limitações e acreditamos na igualdade para todos, princípios que subscrevemos no nosso Plano de Igualdade e Código de Ética, garantindo a igualdade de tratamento e de oportunidades à margem de qualquer condição pessoal, física ou social.Powered by JazzHR
