Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gamdom is home to thousands of betting options for both sports and casino players to wager on. Since 2016, we have been steadily growing to provide more than just casino games and sports betting events to enjoy; With us, you can enjoy unique bonuses and earn massive rewards simultaneously. Discover all the rewarding features Gamdom can offer you below.

Gamdom is seeking a Data Analyst with strong technical skills to join our fast-paced data team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of analytics, engineering, and visualization. You'll bring hands-on experience in SQL, Snowflake, and dbt, along with business-facing skills in reporting, dashboard development (using Tableau), and data analysis to drive insights across the company.

The successful candidate will analyze existing reporting logic, collaborate with data engineers to design robust data models and data marts, and build scalable, high-impact Tableau dashboards. You will also support the transition of reports and dashboards to our new Snowflake environment and provide actionable insights to stakeholders across finance, CRM, marketing, and operations.

We’re looking for someone who is independent, proactive, and adaptable—comfortable managing their workload, collaborating across teams, and driving solutions forward with minimal supervision. The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics, confident in SQL and data modeling, and experienced in working alongside engineers and analysts to translate business needs into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze SQL queries in Tableau and Snowflake datasets to extract key KPIs, metrics, and business logic.
Collaborate with data engineers to build robust reporting data models and data marts in Snowflake.
Act as a bridge between stakeholders and data engineering—gathering requirements, clarifying business definitions, and ensuring accurate metric implementation.
Design, develop, and optimize Tableau dashboards aligned with business needs and performance standards.
Support the migration of reports and dashboards to the new Snowflake environment.
Conduct data analysis to generate actionable insights for finance, CRM, marketing, and operations teams.
Clearly communicate new data models and metrics to BI and data analysts to ensure adoption and consistency.
Provide support for ad hoc data analyses, reporting requests, and broader data initiatives.
Contribute to data governance by documenting definitions, processes, and ensuring consistency across the organization.
Assist in advanced analytics initiatives, such as fraud detection, customer segmentation, churn analysis, and performance tracking.


Required Skills & Competencies


2–4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within the casino, iGaming, or online entertainment industry.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Snowflake and dbt (or similar tools) for data modeling and ETL.
Proficiency in Tableau or similar BI tools (e.g., Power BI), including dashboard design and optimization.
Solid understanding of SQL-based data modeling, warehousing principles, and KPI frameworks.
Ability to work independently, manage competing priorities, and proactively solve problems.
Strong analytical mindset with excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Familiarity with tools like Jira for backlog and task management (a plus).
Understanding of data privacy considerations in analytics.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field (preferred).


Why Join Us


Work with a talented, collaborative team on meaningful, high-impact projects.
Help shape the future of analytics in a fast-growing, innovative company.
Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge cloud data platforms and tools.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and strong opportunities for professional growth.
Show more

Title: Business Support Analytics
Description:
Job Title

Business Support Analytics

Job Description Summary

Job Description

Are you curious, dynamic, eager to learn and interested to work in a fast-paced environment? At Cushman & Wakefield, we are looking for a Business Support professional to join our investment team!

What You’ll Do


Support various business units with proactiveness assuring database and research info updated
Collaborating to promote operational efficiency
Contribute to process improvements and innovative initiatives
Support business operations through documentation and compliance reviews, as well as finance-related tasks


What Will Make You Successful


Passion for innovation and continuous learning
Resilient mindset and a proactive attitude
Strong multidisciplinary collaboration skills
Curious to explore digital tools and new the AI trends/opportunities
To support the several day-to-day operations


Why join us?


Be part of a vibrant, forward-thinking team
Work in a culture that values curiosity, innovation, and growth
Gain exposure to multiple areas of the business within Real Estate
Enjoy a flexible and supportive work environment
Learn and grow with mentorship and hands-on experience


Requirements

✅ Ideally 2-3 years' experience in business support areas.

✅ Advanced Excel skills required, plus knowledge of Python and Power BI (from a user perspective)

✅Portuguese native and Fluency in English - required, ( Spanish proficiency is a valued asset.)

✅ High sense of responsibility, resilience, communicative, attention to detail, proactivity and willing to learn.

✅ Higher education in a relevant field.

What We Offer

💼 Competitive salary package

🍽️ Meal allowance.

🏥 Health insurance.

📈 Ongoing training and great opportunities for professional growth in a dynamic and experienced team.

📍 Lisbon

INCO: “Cushman & Wakefield”

Job Title

Business Support Analytics

Job Description Summary

Job Description

Are you curious, dynamic, eager to learn and interested to work in a fast-paced environment? At Cushman & Wakefield, we are looking for a Business Support professional to join our investment team!

What You’ll Do

  • Support various business units with proactiveness assuring database and research info updated
  • Collaborating to promote operational efficiency
  • Contribute to process improvements and innovative initiatives
  • Support business operations through documentation and compliance reviews, as well as finance-related tasks

What Will Make You Successful

  • Passion for innovation and continuous learning
  • Resilient mindset and a proactive attitude
  • Strong multidisciplinary collaboration skills
  • Curious to explore digital tools and new the AI trends/opportunities
  • To support the several day-to-day operations

Why join us?

  • Be part of a vibrant, forward-thinking team
  • Work in a culture that values curiosity, innovation, and growth
  • Gain exposure to multiple areas of the business within Real Estate
  • Enjoy a flexible and supportive work environment
  • Learn and grow with mentorship and hands-on experience

Requirements

✅ Ideally 2-3 years' experience in business support areas.

✅ Advanced Excel skills required, plus knowledge of Python and Power BI (from a user perspective)

✅Portuguese native and Fluency in English - required, ( Spanish proficiency is a valued asset.)

✅ High sense of responsibility, resilience, communicative, attention to detail, proactivity and willing to learn.

✅ Higher education in a relevant field.

What We Offer

💼 Competitive salary package

🍽️ Meal allowance.

🏥 Health insurance.

📈 Ongoing training and great opportunities for professional growth in a dynamic and experienced team.

📍 Lisbon

INCO: “Cushman & Wakefield”

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary

Keyrus is looking for a Data Governance Analyst. The ideal candidate embodies technical prowess in RISK Systems by defining and embedding data governance policies, procedures, and standards, coupled with a fervent commitment to making every piece of data matter. We value individuals who are detail-oriented, independent contributors with exceptional communication and problem-solving skills, ensuring that together, we continue to transform possibilities into reality.

This position is Hybrid/on-site in Lisbon and it is for a 7-month project.

Note: All applications/CV’s must be submitted in English.

Key Responsibilities


Implement and promote data governance best practices across the RISK Systems landscape
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including data definitions, standards, metrics, and methodologies
Collaborate on the development and enhancement of data governance tools
Contribute to the review and enhancement of existing critical data assets
Monitor data governance performance and report on adherence to defined standards
Support the management of data quality committees and related governance forums
Assist in developing strategies for managing the full lifecycle of data
Ensure teams understand and follow established data governance principles


Requirements For The Role


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Risk Management, IT, or a related discipline
At least 3 years of experience in a data-related or risk management role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to produce clear, concise, and high-quality documentation
Strong interpersonal skills; capable of working across global teams
Self-starter with a delivery-focused mindset and strong organisational skills
Practical experience with data validation, loading, and quality assurance processes
Familiarity with market and counterparty risk concepts is a plus
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal


What We Offer At Keyrus Portugal


Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of €8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?

Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration – Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on.

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness.

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here.

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

At Keyrus Portugal, we're more than just a company - we're a constellation of bright minds and innovative souls.

If you're seeking a place where your passion meets purpose, where every project is a canvas and every challenge an opportunity, then look no further.

Join us, and be a part of a community that's shaping the digital frontier. At Keyrus Portugal, your journey to greatness begins.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays - we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.

Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.

We're searching for a talented and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our growing analytics team. You’ll be partnering closely with product teams across Pleo to unlock value from our rich data to build great products and drive growth. Your insights will directly influence key product decisions, driving significant growth and improving the experience of our customers.

What You Will Be Doing

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will:


Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior and product performance data to identify key trends, opportunities, and risks, and translate those findings into actionable insights
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize product features and improve user engagement, ensuring statistical rigor and validity
Identify and deliver scalable methods of providing self-serve product analytics empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions that lead to faster iteration cycles and improved product outcomes
Gain a deep understanding of our customers needs and experiences to identify opportunities to improve customer experience CX
Contribute to identification, development and delivery of data-driven products
Supporting our data governance initiatives, aligning measurement and metrics across business areas domains
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


What You Bring

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Senior Data Analyst with a strong product analytics background, ideally in a fintech/SaaS company
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have deep experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML, and product analytics tools such as Amplitude
Have a customer-centric approach to solving business problems, using data to improve customer experience
Have strong statistical knowledge, with experience in experimentation at scale
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Harness your understanding of business and product strategy, to provide actionable, insightful recommendations
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work, with ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with close attention to detail.


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application

  • Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
  • We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
  • We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
  • When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Data Analyst (I)
Description:
Na AXIANS procuramos o talento certo, para o lugar certo. Trabalhamos diariamente para envolver as nossas pessoas num ambiente colaborativo e inclusivo, com uma cultura de proximidade. Faz também parte da nossa cultura a preocupação com o meio ambiente e a realização de ações de responsabilidade corporativa social e ambiental.

Esta pode ser a sua oportunidade de integrar uma empresa de âmbito internacional, com um projeto que precisa de si para responder aos desafios da transformação digital.

💻 O CARGO

Estamos à procura de um #TechTalent para desempenhar funções como Data Analyst num projeto na área de energias.

💡 O QUE PROCURAMOS


Com 5 anos de experiência na área, ou com funções semelhantes;
Proficiência em ferramentas de Dashboards, linguagem SQL e ferramentas Office;
Experiência e/ou conhecimento em modelação de dados (SAS Enterprise Guide, DOMO, etc.);
Experiência na criação de User Stories para Data Warehouse;
Conhecimentos da gestão de acessos a utilizadores;
Fluência em português (escrito e oral) - proficiência em inglês (valorizado).


⭐ O QUE TE PODEMOS OFERECER

Oportunidades para progredires na carreira

Integrando projetos de grande dimensão da Axians, podes realizar formações e certificações em diversas áreas tecnológicas que te ajudarão a aumentar a tua expertise.

Desenvolvimento como profissional em mercados internacionais

Com os projetos internacionais que temos para ti serás posto/a à prova, ganhando experiência, provando o teu valor e tornando-te realmente bom/boa no que fazes.

Desafios aliciantes de grande dimensão

Oferecemos-te desafios à tua medida, que te permitam desenvolver competências na área que mais desejas e, quem sabe, tornares-te um/a expert.

Apoio no desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal

Beneficias da oferta da Axians que inclui um plano Friend Get a Friend, bem como a progressão na empresa através de um plano de carreira.

Achas que esta vaga é a tua cara?

Se achas que tens #TechTalent necessário para esta vaga, envia-nos o teu currículo, de preferência em inglês e em formato Europass, para recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com com o subject “DA.IB.DB”.

Saber mais sobre a Axians

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Business Intelligence Consultant willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa - must live in Portugal - mandatory).

Are you the one?


Design data schemas, modeling data structures and perform data migrations.
Design high-performance data pipelines & ETL processes.
Business Intelligence Professional – Key Qualifications.
Minimum of 3 years of experience with SQL.
Hands-on experience with SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services).
Proficient in Power BI (DAX) for data visualization and reporting.
Preferred knowledge of Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, and Python.
Strong interest and enthusiasm for consultancy work.


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By


Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.


Oh… And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to joana.ferreira@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.
Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


Job Information

About TikTok

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.

We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Join Us at Closer Consulting!

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation – we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home. We provide our people with the means, opportunities, and support they need to thrive and innovate. ✨

For this position, it is necessary to have a residence in Lisbon, PT.

We seek a Data Analyst professional who is willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid project.

What You'll Be Doing


Design and maintain business dashboards and impactful data visualizations
Analyze large and complex datasets to support strategic and operational decisions
Build and optimize data pipelines using Airflow, SQL, and Python
Ensure data quality and consistency across referential sources ✅
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs and deliver insights
Support continuous improvement of data processes and analytical tools
Work in Agile teams and contribute to the evolution of third-party data ecosystems ⚙️☁️


What We're Looking For


6+ years of experience in data analysis, functional/technical specification, and data modeling
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, and PySpark
Experience with Oracle databases (SQL Server/PostgreSQL is a plus)
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, or other visualization tools
Familiarity with Airflow for pipeline orchestration ⏱️
Experience in Data Warehousing and file formats like Parquet
Ability to work with APIs and knowledge of Git is a plus
Solid grasp of Agile methodologies (SCRUM)


Soft Skills That Matter


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and stakeholder management ️
Proactivity, autonomy, and adaptability
Attention to detail and ability to synthesize information
Team spirit and client orientation


Languages

English – Fluent (preferred)

French – Intermediate (nice to have)

Portuguese – Fluent (mandatory)

Nice To Have


Knowledge of referential data and banking domain (consumer credit)
Tools like Jira, Confluence, and Draw.IO for documentation and collaboration


We Believe We Are The Ones To


Providing a multidisciplinary Team
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth
Providing you with a custom training plan
Helping you reach happiness


Oh… And By The Way, We Also Have


Several challenging complex projects
Stimulating teams and leaders
World-class Clients and Partners


If you enjoy turning data into business-driving decisions, we'd like to talk to you. Send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and discover the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst (Python & Oracle)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst (Python & Oracle) for an international project.

💡 What We're Looking For


2+ years of relevant experience in technical roles;
Proficient in Python;
Proven experience with SQL and relational database management (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL);
Profiency with PySpark and Apache Airflow;
Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban);
Fluency in English (written and spoken).


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject "DAPO/IB/DB”.

Learn more about Axians
Show more

Title: Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

The Position

The Protective Intelligence function as part of Organon Security and Resilience (OSR) organization, supports corporate security programs in collaboration with the OSR CoEs and Regional teams. The function is responsible for the Organon Security & Resilience Center with 24/7 coverage.

We are currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence. This role will support the Insider Risk program, Strategic Intelligence program, Travel Risk Management program and All-hazard threat intelligence monitoring (such as natural disasters, security incidents, geopolitical situations) and collection in order to proactively inform on and mitigate risks that could impact business operations, facilities and personnel.

This role will report to the Associate Director of Protective Intelligence, who oversees a team of analysts who monitor intelligence feeds and open-source channels, assess potential impact, and report to stakeholders in a timely manner. The team also services the company’s 24/7 crisis management contact point, triaging to the appropriate Security & Resilience leaders to provide business critical support during incidents.

Responsibilities


Participates as a team member to ensure coverage of 24/7 emergency telephone line that escalates external and internal events that have the potential to negatively impact Organon employees, facilities, operations, cause physical or environmental damage, or threaten financial standing, reputation, or property.
Conducts proactive reviews to determine if threats exist to Organon Executives, travelers or events.
Alert Security & Resilience members about threats to Organon.
Manage tools and technologies that ensure founders’ wellbeing and support Country Incident Management Teams, Corporate Incident Assessment Team and Corporate Crisis Management Team, as warranted.
Report Cyber Security Incidents and Product Integrity incidents.
Provide strategic analysis of threat events to senior managers.
Provide tactical assessments and support.
Data scraping in open source and vendors to identify security deteriorations and trends.
Drive best practices and provide guidance.
Includes shift work (after hours, weekends and holidays).


Education Minimum Requirement

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required -

Bachelor’s degree in in Security Studies, Political Science, International Relations or related field.

Required Experience And Skills


3 - 4 years’ relevant experience in a security operations center, or similar environment with analytical, investigative, emergency response, security or geopolitical assessment experience
Expertise in multi-source intelligence collection, assessment and dissemination.
Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, including analytic methodologies and techniques.
Strong oral and written communication skills, especially in preparing clear and concise summaries of critical events in a timely manner.
Excellent attention to detail.
Demonstrated experience synthesizing large amounts of information from multiple sources into concise, analytic assessments.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive information.
Action oriented with a passion for getting things done quickly, efficiently, and properly.
Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual and stressful circumstances
English language fluency
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include Teams.


Others


Advanced degree and / or relevant certifications is a plus
Other languages a plus.


Secondary Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Requisition ID:R533044

HTML:
Job Description

The Position

The Protective Intelligence function as part of Organon Security and Resilience (OSR) organization, supports corporate security programs in collaboration with the OSR CoEs and Regional teams. The function is responsible for the Organon Security & Resilience Center with 24/7 coverage.

We are currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst - Protective Intelligence. This role will support the Insider Risk program, Strategic Intelligence program, Travel Risk Management program and All-hazard threat intelligence monitoring (such as natural disasters, security incidents, geopolitical situations) and collection in order to proactively inform on and mitigate risks that could impact business operations, facilities and personnel.

This role will report to the Associate Director of Protective Intelligence, who oversees a team of analysts who monitor intelligence feeds and open-source channels, assess potential impact, and report to stakeholders in a timely manner. The team also services the company’s 24/7 crisis management contact point, triaging to the appropriate Security & Resilience leaders to provide business critical support during incidents.

Responsibilities

  • Participates as a team member to ensure coverage of 24/7 emergency telephone line that escalates external and internal events that have the potential to negatively impact Organon employees, facilities, operations, cause physical or environmental damage, or threaten financial standing, reputation, or property.
  • Conducts proactive reviews to determine if threats exist to Organon Executives, travelers or events.
  • Alert Security & Resilience members about threats to Organon.
  • Manage tools and technologies that ensure founders’ wellbeing and support Country Incident Management Teams, Corporate Incident Assessment Team and Corporate Crisis Management Team, as warranted.
  • Report Cyber Security Incidents and Product Integrity incidents.
  • Provide strategic analysis of threat events to senior managers.
  • Provide tactical assessments and support.
  • Data scraping in open source and vendors to identify security deteriorations and trends.
  • Drive best practices and provide guidance.
  • Includes shift work (after hours, weekends and holidays).

Education Minimum Requirement

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required -

Bachelor’s degree in in Security Studies, Political Science, International Relations or related field.

Required Experience And Skills

  • 3 - 4 years’ relevant experience in a security operations center, or similar environment with analytical, investigative, emergency response, security or geopolitical assessment experience
  • Expertise in multi-source intelligence collection, assessment and dissemination.
  • Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, including analytic methodologies and techniques.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills, especially in preparing clear and concise summaries of critical events in a timely manner.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated experience synthesizing large amounts of information from multiple sources into concise, analytic assessments.
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality with sensitive information.
  • Action oriented with a passion for getting things done quickly, efficiently, and properly.
  • Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual and stressful circumstances
  • English language fluency
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite to include Teams.

Others

  • Advanced degree and / or relevant certifications is a plus
  • Other languages a plus.

Secondary Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. Requisition ID:R533044

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Create/Update some dashboards
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model
You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges
The team is young, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have…


A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field?
At least 3 years of relevant experience
Strong programming skills in Python?
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English.
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe


If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for...

We look forward to receiving your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Data&AI, que tem suportado milhares de clientes na evolução/criação das suas plataformas de dados, analítica e IA e, por isso, procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia será composto por vários desafios, dos quais podemos elencar alguns:

  • Desenho e implementação de Arquiteturas de Dados escaláveis utilizando tecnologias de ponta com um foco na Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS, Alibaba Cloud);
  • Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes para Datalakes e Data Warehouses;
  • Definição e implementação de processos para controlo e tratamento de dados (Data Quality, Profiling, Cleansing, Masking, entre outros);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time;
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders em projetos nacionais e internacionais;
  • Colaborar com múltiplos colegas da rede Deloitte, tirando partido do conhecimento e projetos internacionais que já decorreram e que estão a decorrer;
  • Assumir gradualmente a coordenação de equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;
  • Propor novas ideias e criar provas de conceito para diferentes desafios.


Procuramos profissionais com algumas das valências abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores, Matemática ou áreas similares;
  • Experiência profissional entre 1 e 6 anos em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL / NoSQL;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos: Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, FiveTran, DBT, Talend, Matillion, Databricks);
  • Conhecimentos em Python, PySpark;
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experiência previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Domínio da língua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigatório);
  • Valorizamos também profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de língua francesa e alemã.
  • Valorizamos certificações orientadas aos projetos de dados;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Boas capacidades de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade, sentido crítico, curiosidade.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos;
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização;
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências;
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga. Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, em plataformas tecnológicas de transformação organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na indústria de serviços financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências nalguma destas áreas em soluções tecnológicas – engenharia de software, cloud, integração de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunicações, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, então estás no lugar certo!

Sabe mais em www.deloitte.com/pt/careers .

Keywords : Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: Data Governance Analyst
HTML:
WIRE IT was born during the pandemic period and is proudly based in Portugal. Our values are built around today's IT reality: flexibility, transparency, trust, freedom, digital mindset, and the creation of Focused Partnerships making a real difference through trusted relationships with our collaborators and clients.

We are an IT services company operating worldwide, driven by an experienced and senior team that helps clients make the right decisions in a fast-moving market.

If you're looking for more than just a job - if you're looking for a place where you can truly make a difference - you might be the next person to join WIRE IT.

Role: Data Governance Analyst.

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon.

Required Skills

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar;
  • Min. 2 years of experience as a Data Governance Analyst;
  • Experience implementing data governance best practices;
  • Experience in preparing and updating key documentation;
  • Experience in Data or Risk related businesses;
  • Experience producing high quality documentations;
  • Experience in direct communication with stakeholders;
  • Responsible and proactive;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team;
  • Organized professional with attention to details;
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (spoken and written).

We Offer

  • No-term full-time contract;
  • Health Insurance;
  • 22 days of paid vacation;
  • 4 extra days annually (Carnival, Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Birthday);
  • Meal Allowance on card (Coverflex);
  • Referral Bonus;
  • Special discounts and flex options;
  • Training annual budget;
  • A great team-oriented culture;
  • Chance to become a part of a dynamically growing international company;
  • Challenging projects giving the unique opportunity to grow and learn.

Following the EU General Data Protection Regulation No. 2016/679, we inform you that by responding to this announcement, you consent to the use of your data by Wire IT, for as long as necessary. In case of doubt or request for elimination of your personal data, please send an email to info@wireit.pt.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your main activies are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.


Behavioral Skills

Profile and skills to success


Ability to synthetize/simplify: Expert
Communication skills - oral & written: Expert
Ability to deliver/Results driven: Expert


Transversal Skills


Analytical Ability: Expert
Ability to manage a project: Proficient


Business Skills


Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics: Expert


Languages


English (Fluent)


Tools and Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)


Experience, Academic Background & Other Qualifications

Field of Expertise


Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)


Academic Background


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics
Masters in Information Technology and Computer Science


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Visualization (Looker)
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Data Visualization willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team in a hybrid/remote model (*Lisboa/ Carnaxide - must live in Portugal - mandatory).

Are you the one?


2/3+ years of experience in Data roles (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, etc.);
Advanced knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and transformation;
Experience with Power BI and/or Looker (LookML);
Solid understanding of ETL, data pipelines, cleaning, and modeling;
English proficiency at B1 level or higher (comfortable with technical reading and basic communication).


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By

Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.

Helping you reach happiness.

Title: Data Analyst - Operational and Permanent Control Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The OPC analyst plays a key role in Global Banking CCCO(Chief Conduct and Control Officer) Office Front-to-Ops missions and worldwide mandate to identify and assess non-financial risks, to ensure the enforcement and efficiency of the control framework and to promote an adequate risk management culture. The Analyst contributes to Global Banking CCCO leading the Front-to-Operations to IT alignment for Global Banking across the three regions to strengthen and industrialize GB non-financial risk management set-up, anticipate regulators' expectations and protect the interests of the Bank' stakeholders.

Specifically, the OPC(Operational and Permanent Control) Analyst operates the Control framework relating to all operational risks, including Fraud, Third Party, Conduct, Compliance, Regulatory, Information & Communication Technology risks, and others risks types.

Your Main Activities Are


Performing/driving the risk identification and assessment in liaison with independent control Functions when needed
Ensuring validation by the relevant management level and consistency with the defined risk tolerance.
Contributing to the definition and follow-up of remediation plan if needed
Centralize and automate the production of reports gathering major operational risks indicators via automated KPI/KRI dashboards
Automate, when possible and relevant, sampling creation, control execution, and control reporting across the full value chain
Manage Procedures by ensuring that Group procedures requirements are implemented locally, complemented with local specificities
Ensure that the procedures designed by the businesses and functions are identified, updated, properly stored and communicated to the relevant stakeholders within the Operating Entity
Identify and propose calibration of procedures according to the outcome of the risk assessment and other risk events
Perform and/or coordinate controls according to this control plan
Ensure that control results are reviewed and analyzed by the Management and when relevant by operational teams / relevant stakeholders and that remediation action plans are defined if and when needed
Input in Group tools the control results and major action plans. Follow-up the implementation of remediation actions
Collect incidents, report and update in the incidents database, including suspected and attempted fraud cases
Analyze incidents in a timely manner and define, jointly with the relevant stakeholders, the correctives measures be implemented to mitigate risks
Follow-up and /or initiate the implementation of remediation actions and the unfolding of long-term incidents.
Perform controls on the incident collection process, particularly the cross-check with other databases and the half-yearly attestation by the local management.
Alert and escalate to the relevant level of management any operational risk incident and any recurring weakness.
Perform periodic and ad-hoc reporting to the appropriate level of management as well as to independent control functions
Ensure an appropriate training on Operational risks and Permanent Control framework is provided to employees, notably newcomers
Show ability to take ownership of specific OPC activity streams/topics and be able to deliver the full and exhaustive actions taken on the assigned processes to the management.


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, Finance or any similar areas
Advanced level of english fluency, both oral and written
Up to 2 years of experience in data analytics, operational risk or compliance activities
Experience using Microsoft Office Tools, particularly Excel
Proficiency in Power BI, Python and SQL
Attention to detail and creative thinking


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group's retail activities and specialized business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialized businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit [1] https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing and improving data quality within the organization. You will be responsible for implementing data quality control processes, identifying anomalies, proposing solutions to ensure data integrity and reliability and building HR activity monitoring dashboards.

Your Main Activities Are


Understanding the data quality needs expressed by various HR teams and the Data Analysts of the team;
Developing and implementing data quality strategies to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability;
Conducting regular data audits to identify errors and inconsistencies;
Documenting data quality processes and training teams on best practices;
Clearly and concisely communicating data quality analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders;
Developing and updating monitoring or activity management dashboards (Power BI and Tableau).


Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have significant experience as a data analyst, management controller, auditor, or consultant in a data quality-oriented position;

You hold excellent ability to analyze and interpret complex data;

You are a good communicator and can clearly and intelligibly convey your analyses and results to various stakeholders;

You have solid experience in data visualization and data preparation;

Finally, we place particular importance on our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Product Owner) and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of human resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data quality and security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical skills (Expert)

Project management skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and training (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication skills – oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
