Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams’ performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank’s assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Cash/Data Analyst
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?

Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!




A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.




O que precisas para ser um SMART CASH/DATA ANALYST?

Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Informática de Gestão ou similar
Análise de estatística de indicadores, identificação de tendências / padrões, …
Sólidos conhecimentos em Office, nomeadamente Excel e Access
Conhecimentos de Bases de Dados relacionais (SQL Server e TSQL)
Conhecimentos de Linguagens de programação (ex.: VBA) - plus
Conhecimentos de SI e métodos de integração entre SI - plus




Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?

Análise diária de indicadores (capacidade vs consumo de cash permanente ou temporário)
Geração diária de ordens de abastecimento de acordo com as necessidades de consumo
Elaboração de relatórios de performance
Análise de faturas de fornecedores, validando contra as ordens solicitadas, entre outros itens.
Elaboração de conteúdos / apresentações / documentos / relatórios para Clientes Externos e Internos
Participação em reuniões de equipa




Porquê ser SMART?

Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.
Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.
Somos simples e eficientes.
Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.
Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.




Onde podes ser SMART?

Lisboa.
Show more
HTML:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?

Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart!


A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Somos uma empresa de consultoria tecnológica com mais de uma década de experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e internacionais em IT e Telecomunicações e queremos fazer parte da tua história.


O que precisas para ser um SMART CASH/DATA ANALYST?

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Informática de Gestão ou similar
  • Análise de estatística de indicadores, identificação de tendências / padrões, …
  • Sólidos conhecimentos em Office, nomeadamente Excel e Access
  • Conhecimentos de Bases de Dados relacionais (SQL Server e TSQL)
  • Conhecimentos de Linguagens de programação (ex.: VBA) - plus
  • Conhecimentos de SI e métodos de integração entre SI - plus


Quais serão as tuas funções na SMART?

  • Análise diária de indicadores (capacidade vs consumo de cash permanente ou temporário)
  • Geração diária de ordens de abastecimento de acordo com as necessidades de consumo
  • Elaboração de relatórios de performance
  • Análise de faturas de fornecedores, validando contra as ordens solicitadas, entre outros itens.
  • Elaboração de conteúdos / apresentações / documentos / relatórios para Clientes Externos e Internos
  • Participação em reuniões de equipa


Porquê ser SMART?

  • Tornamos reais os projetos em que participamos.
  • Amamos o que fazemos e temos orgulho no resultado do nosso trabalho.
  • Somos simples e eficientes.
  • Valorizamos as nossas pessoas.
  • Somos uma equipa dinâmica, íntegra e de confiança.


Onde podes ser SMART?

  • Lisboa.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
At Curaleaf International, we're not just participating in the cannabis industry—we're leading it.

As part of the world’s largest cannabis company, Curaleaf Holding, Inc., we are powered by a strong presence at all stages of the supply chain. Our unique distribution network throughout Europe, Canada and Australasia brings together pioneering research with cutting-edge cultivation, extraction, and production. Amidst a rapid growth trajectory, our emphasis on quality and expertise aims to deliver safe and legal cannabis.

Curaleaf Clinics: Curaleaf Clinic is the largest medical cannabis clinic in the UK and remains one of the highest rated services. Offering consultations for a range of conditions where there is evidence for the use of medical cannabis, Curaleaf Clinic is dedicated to improving access to medical cannabis for patients.

Curaleaf Pharmacy: Curaleaf Pharmacy the UK’s first distance selling pharmacy specialising in medical cannabis, is regulated by the GPhC. The pharmacy fulfils medical cannabis prescriptions supporting safe and affordable access to medical cannabis.

Curaleaf Laboratories: Curaleaf Laboratories is a leading manufacturer and distributor of medical cannabis in the UK. The state-of-the-art MHRA-approved manufacturing facility enables Curaleaf Laboratories to meet growing patient demand for a consistent range of medical cannabis products.

Our Vision: To shape the future of cannabis through our commitment to research and product excellence

Our Mission: To be the world’s leading cannabis company consistently delivering superior products and services and driving the global acceptance of cannabis.

Our Values:


Lead & Inspire
Commit to Win
Driven to Deliver Excellence
Customer Obsession
One Curaleaf


Position:

The role of Master Data Analyst is to support the maintenance of accurateand consistent data throughout the business. The role will closely work with teams in supply, production, warehousing, product and finance to ensure that the integrity of the Company’s central data is upheld. This role will require attention to detail, analytical skills and the ability to use multiple platforms.


To assist in maintaining the ‘Single Source of Truth’ for Master Data in Portugal and the wider business.
To run the pre-validation process for Master Data on site in Portugal.
To act as a Super User for Business Central (ERP system) for Portugal and to assist internationally where needed.
To provide analytical insight into the local processes of manufacturing, and to provide reporting back of these insights to the local and wider teams.
To identify and resolve data inaccuracies across the business units.
To ensure all barcoding is done in accordance with the GS1 standards implemented across the business.


Requirements:


Ability to analyse data for insights and inaccuracies.
Ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the business.
Experience in managing high volumes of data and multiple databases.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills in Portuguese and a good working level of English.
Strong working knowledge of MS Office.
Previous experience with an ERP system such as Business Central or NetSuite would be an advantage


Other information:

On site - between Alcochete and Setúbal
Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
A Mudum Seguros é uma empresa, do setor segurador, que pertence ao Grupo Crédit Agricole um dos maiores grupos bancários Europeu.

O grupo Crédit Agricole está presente em 47 países, junta 142.000 colaboradores e gere 51 milhões de clientes à escala global.

A nossa missão, da Mudum, é prestar um contributo decisivo para a confiança e segurança das pessoas, procurando distinguir-se pela simplicidade e facilidade das escolhas apresentadas, pela confiança construída com base na clareza da linguagem utilizada, pela qualidade de serviço e pela rapidez no tratamento das necessidades dos clientes.


Senior Business Intelligence

A função estará inserida na Direção de Atuariado, Resseguro e Advanced Analytics , na área de Business Intelligence, da Mudum e tem como missão dar suporte à nova estratégia Digital e de Dados da empresa.


O que esperamos de Ti?

  • Desenvolvimento e implementação de projetos de Business Intelligence, criando soluções inovadoras que capacitam a empresa a tomar decisões estratégicas baseadas em dados concretos e atualizados;
  • Implementação e otimização de modelos semânticos em Power BI, assegurando a interpretação precisa e contextualizada dos dados, facilitando análises mais profundas e insights acionáveis;
  • Criação de dashboards interativos e relatórios dinâmicos utilizando ferramentas como Power BI, proporcionando visualizações intuitivas e personalizadas para diferentes níveis de usuários;
  • Análise aprofundada e interpretação criteriosa dos dados para identificar tendências emergentes, padrões significativos e oportunidades de negócio latentes, contribuindo para a vantagem competitiva da empresa;
  • Supervisão proativa da monitorização dos processos implementados em Power BI, assegurando o funcionamento ótimo e contínuo. Isso envolve a identificação precoce de problemas, otimização de desempenho e implementação de melhorias contínuas para maximizar a eficácia das soluções de BI;
  • Gestão e manutenção eficiente do catálogo de dados, garantindo a execução rigorosa das políticas da empresa. Isso inclui a organização meticulosa, acessibilidade controlada, segurança robusta e eficiência operacional dos dados corporativos.


Que perfil procuramos?

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Ciência de Dados, Ciência e Visualização de Dados, Gestão de Informação, Matemática, Engenharia Matemática para Análise de Dados ou similar;
  • Mínimo de 4 anos de experiência em funções similares;
  • Experiência em implementação de arquiteturas de business intelligence, modelação, tratamento e transformação de dados;
  • Experiência em desenvolvimento de modelos semânticos de Power BI;
  • Experiência no desenho e desenvolvimento de dashboards e reports em Power BI;
  • Experiência nas ferramentas de Power BI: Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power BI Report Server, Power Apps, Power Automate e Power Query;
  • Forte conhecimento em DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) para criação de cálculos e métricas complexas;
  • Experiência na otimização e gestão da qualidade de dados;
  • Conhecimentos em integração de Power BI com outras fontes (exemplo: API e cloud services);
  • Conhecimentos em Data Governance e Azure Unity Catalogue;
  • Conhecimentos em princípios de UI/UX para criação de interfaces intuitivos e eficientes;
  • Conhecimentos em bases de dados relacionais SQL Server e T-SQL e em tecnologias de ETL (SSAS);
  • Noções de Azure DevOps, Azure Data Factory e Azure DataBricks;
  • Valoriza-se conhecimentos em Agile/ Scrum;
  • Fluência em português e inglês;
  • Forte capacidade analítica e espírito crítico;
  • Capacidade de problem-solving;
  • Fortes capacidades de gestão do tempo e prioridades, de modo a atingir os objetivos, considerando múltiplos deadlines e iniciativas em simultâneo;
  • Capacidade de análise e estruturação da informação de modo a ser partilhada e comunicada aos restante interlocutores e equipas de desenvolvimento e de negócio;
  • Boa capacidade de comunicação;
  • Autonomia e proatividade.


Ser Mudum é ter acesso a:

. Uma experiência profissional numa empresa integrada num grupo internacional líder no seu setor, com medidas de trabalho e horário flexíveis;

. Reconhecimento através de uma remuneração compatível com a função e outros benefícios adicionais;

. Oportunidades de desenvolvimento pessoal e profissional (projetos transversais, mobilidades, voluntariado).


Como empresa socialmente responsável, incorporamos nos nossos valores e práticas os princípios da Diversidade e Inclusão e por isso associados da Carta Portuguesa para a Diversidade. Para alcançarmos os nossos objetivos, pretendemos atrair, desenvolver e reter diferentes perfis, assumindo a diversidade como um fator potenciador e diferenciador de inovação fundamental na nossa organização. Acolhemos e valorizamos todas as pessoas e estamos comprometidos com a inclusão e sentido de pertença de cada pessoa que integre a Mudum Seguros.


Se acha que este desafio é para Ti e que poderás ajudar-nos a crescer ainda mais... envia a tua candidatura!

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Semasio, a Samba TV company, is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands trust our industry-leading advertising solutions to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI. Our team is located globally in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany, and Denmark.




We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community. Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks your curiosity, then read on!




Are you passionate about turning data into insights? Do you have a keen eye for detail and a drive to optimize business performance? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a Junior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team in

Porto. In this role, you will play a key part in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and efficiency of our data models and reports. Your contributions will directly impact strategic decision-making, providing stakeholders with critical insights to drive the company forward.




What You’ll Do:
Maintain and update our BI data model, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Own specific monthly reports and updates, ensuring timely and precise delivery.
Work closely with different teams to understand reporting needs and enhance data quality.
Identify opportunities to improve data structures and reporting processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data inconsistencies or anomalies.
Support the development of new dashboards and analytics solutions.




What We’re Looking For:
Strong attention to detail—nothing slips past you!
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for optimizing data processes.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Basic understanding of data modeling concepts and database structures.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive attitude, always looking for ways to improve and streamline reporting.
A degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.




Why Join Us?
Be part of a data-driven company that values innovation and continuous learning.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment where your contributions matter.
Opportunity for professional growth and development in the exciting field of Business Intelligence.









Samba TV is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.




Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, under the applicable law. For further details, please see Samba's Applicant Privacy Policy. For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




• Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

• Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

• Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

• Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

• Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

• Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

• Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

• Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

• Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

• Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

• Possibility of Working from Home – we care about results not locations;

• Training Budget for each employee – we care about the growth of our people;

• Private Health Insurance – we care about health on and off working hours;

• 3 Additional Vacation Days – we care about free time;

• Cooking, sports or book club – we care about spending time with our folks;

• Fresh fruits – we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

• Fresh coffee, tea or water – we care about boosting your day.

• A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

  • Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
  • Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
  • Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
  • Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.


🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

  • Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
  • 5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
  • Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
  • Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
  • Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
  • Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
  • Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
  • Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
  • A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.



🎉 What we have to offer you?

  • Hybrid working model;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Health & Life Insurance;
  • Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
  • Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
  • More than 6000 free online courses;
  • Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
  • Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
  • Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.


We are waiting for you!


Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)


Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU


Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master’s degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project.

🙂 YOUR DAY TO DAY


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support the company’s internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.


💡 What We're Looking For


Strong knowledge in Data processing, Data quality, and Data management
Proven experience in IT Development and database administration (SQL)
Familiarity with Agile methodologies to drive efficiency
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Pack, particularly Excel
Hands-on experience with Power BI / Tableau for data visualization
Fluency in English and French


⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AS/MO”.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Somos uma empresa de todos e para todos. Com uma base sólida e inclusiva, a MC mantém o foco nas pessoas, para tornar a vida mais simples a clientes, colaboradores ou membros das comunidades. Criamos valor com o contributo de todos, inovamos a cada passo e lideramos de forma próxima, atentos às qualidades e necessidades de cada um. Temos histórias diferentes e ideias diferentes, mas partilhamos o desejo de crescer e de chegar à melhor versão de nós próprios. Tudo o que somos, conseguimos juntos. E não há nada mais inspirador do que isso.

Por isso, se quiseres fazer parte desta equipa e aceitar novos desafios, estamos à tua procura!

Estamos à procura de Data Analyst para a nossa equipa de Gestão do Cartão Continente, em Matosinhos, e acreditamos que seremos #betterwithyou!


Contamos contigo para...

  • Desenvolver, monitorizar e analisar métricas de acompanhamento de operações críticas do programa de fidelização Cartão Continente;
  • Construção de modelo de reporting de operações críticas do programa;
  • Desenvolvimento da framework de controlo de fraude.


Por isso, traz contigo...

  • Formação Superior, preferencialmente em áreas de Gestão, Contabilidade, Auditoria ou similares - Essencial para garantir uma base sólida de conhecimentos analíticos e de negócio.
  • Domínio de MSOffice (VBA) - Importante para automatizar tarefas, analisar dados com eficiência e garantir precisão nos relatórios.
  • Conhecimento de SQL, Azure, Databricks (preferencial) - Fundamental para extrair, tratar e explorar grandes volumes de dados de forma eficaz.
  • Assertividade na comunicação e facilidade de relacionamento interpessoal.
  • Forte capacidade de análise e de tratamento da informação;
  • Capacidade de observação e atenção ao detalhe;
  • Espírito crítico, proatividade e curiosidade intelectual.


O que vais encontrar…

  • Ambiente de trabalho colaborativo;
  • Uma equipa dinâmica;
  • Possibilidades de progressão de carreira e mobilidade interna;
  • Empresa coesa e de referência no setor do retalho.


O que temos para ti…

  • Subsídio de Alimentação em valor ou em Cartão Dá (a opção que for mais vantajosa para ti);
  • Plano de Telecomunicações com voz, dados e equipamento (a colaboradores efetivos);
  • Programa Flex it Up - Dias Off Extra, Licenças sem Vencimento, Modelo de Trabalho Flexível (quando aplicável);
  • Seguro de Saúde e de Vida (a colaboradores efetivos) com possibilidade de extensão do Seguro de Saúde ao agregado familiar com condições vantajosas;
  • Programa de Benefícios Flexíveis;
  • Plano de Onboarding e Formação inicial, plataforma de Formação Contínua e Programa de Literacia Financeira;
  • Prémios Escolares e Bolsas de Mérito para filhos de colaboradores (ensino regular e ensino inclusivo), bem como Programas de Férias nas pausas letivas;
  • Kit Nascimento para o bebé que está a chegar;
  • Programas de Mobilidade Interna para a promoção de talento;
  • Vacina contra a Gripe incluindo a sua aplicação (adesão voluntária);
  • Programa Somos Sonae, de apoio psicossocial, financeiro e jurídico aos colaboradores;
  • Sessões de Ergocoaching;
  • Programas de Promoção da Saúde Mental e Consultas de Nutrição;
  • Programa de Descontos e Parcerias em mais de 300 marcas de referência;
  • Disponibilização de café e fruta gratuitamente no local de trabalho
  • Salário Competitivo.


#BETTERTOGETHER #BETTERWITHYOU


Compromisso de D&I MC Sonae:

Trabalhamos para criar um ambiente de trabalho assente na riqueza de perfis e com foco na singularidade, garantindo que todos se sentem respeitados, valorizados pelas suas competências e têm confiança na organização.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.







Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:




➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems




In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst







MAIN TASKS:




Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management;
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Bachelor’s degree in fields such as computer science, data science, or related fields.
Experience with data knowledge/data processing/data quality
Experience with Database Management (SQL)
Experience with Power BI and Tableau
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a team.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 13 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Licenciatura em Sistemas de Informação, Gestão, Engenharia ou áreas similares;
  • Valorizada a competência em integração e modelação de dados;
  • Proficiência em SQL e DAX;
  • Experiência nas ferramentas Python e Power BI;


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:


https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A PrimeIT é uma empresa líder com 19 escritórios internacionais, focada em fornecer serviços de IT, Telecomunicações e Engenharia. Impulsionamos o negócio dos nossos parceiros, utilizando a tecnologia mais avançada e os melhores profissionais do setor. Os nossos 17 anos de experiência tornam-nos especialistas em Team Extension, Nearshore, Managed Services e Custom Software. Para isso, contamos atualmente com uma equipa de mais de 2350 profissionais que colaboram em projetos nacionais e internacionais nas mais diversas tecnologias.




LISBOA | PORTO | MADRID | BARCELONA | PARIS | LYON | NANTES | LILLE | AIX-EN-PROVENCE | BORDEAUX | GRENOBLE | TOURS | MILANO | GENÈVE | KATOWICE | WARSZAWA | WROCŁAW | LONDON | SÃO PAULO

💻 Regime: Híbrido

🔎 O que procuramos?

+2 anos de experiência como Data Analyst
Experiência com ferramentas e frameworks de ETL

Integração numa empresa de dimensão internacional que cresce diariamente;
Formação constante nas mais recentes e inovadoras tecnologias – Prime Academy;
Acompanhamento e progressão de carreira.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar’s BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company’s business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team’s existing BI assets.

What You’ll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team’s efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team’s efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What’s In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise

With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.







Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems







In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development.
Database Management (SQL).
Methodologies (Agile).
Office Pack (MS Excel).
Power BI / Tableau.
Fluency in English is required.
Practice in French (Desirable).




📍Hybrid Model at the Porto office.




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Com mais de 7 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:


  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.


Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:


  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.


O que procuramos:


  • Licenciatura em Engenharia, Gestão, Informática ou similares;
  • Experiência comprovada como Data Analyst ou posição equivalente;
  • Forte conhecimento em SQL e base de dados relacionais e não relacionais;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de visualização de dados (ex.: Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.);
  • Experiência com Python e/ou R para análise de dados e automação de processos;
  • Capacidade de traduzir requisitos de negócio em análises acionáveis e estratégias baseadas em dados;
  • Habilidade de comunicação e storytelling para apresentar insights de forma clara e estratégica.



Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.


We walk with you!



Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Business/Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Business/Data Analyst to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.


As a Business Analyst you will work in a Agile environment and you must be able to respond quickly and work on ad hoc requests from within and across teams regarding evolutionary maintenance tasks and production support.


What you will do:

  • Gather and analyze Business Requirements for new and ongoing projects;
  • Manage and respond to support requests;
  • Write specifications and user stories according to project requirements;
  • Define the plan for implementation of requests/projects;
  • Track and report project progress.


What you are like:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Solid knowledge in financial products and market data;
  • Proven experience in IT Business Analysis or Analytics;
  • Knowledge in mathematics and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Python and R are a plus, but not mandatory)
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
  • Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira and Confluence;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • Good level of English – minimum B2 (mandatory);


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
// Bee motto

if (me.dareToChange() == true) { me.sendCV(); me.happy(true); }


Somos uma consultora de tecnologias de informação com foco em projetos de Engenharia associados às Tecnologias da Informação. Atuamos em dois eixos principais: OTS e DxSpark, concentrando o que fazemos de melhor em cada um deles. Contamos com uma equipa diversa, de cerca de 200 profissionais, apaixonados e comprometidos em transformar desafios em oportunidades.

Entra em contacto connosco e embarca nesta jornada rumo ao sucesso, aqui vais encontrar o teu próximo desafio #daretochange.


Dare to Have:

  • Formação superior na área de Informática (ou similar)
  • Experiência comprovada em SQL Server;
  • Fortes conhecimentos de Python (Pandas; Numpy; Seaborn; Matplotlib);
  • Fluência em inglês (mínimo B2);
  • Conhecimentos de francês (B1) – opcional;
  • Disponibilidade para trabalhar em modelo híbrido no Porto (2 a 3x por semana).



Dare to live:

Global Mindset | integração numa empresa internacional de rápido crescimento;

Continuous Learning | plano de formação e certificação gratuitas em tecnologias, metodologias, línguas e soft-skills;

Infinite Feedback | acompanhamento e progressão de carreira;

Health | Seguro de saúde, dentário e seguro de vida;

Partnerships | benefícios e descontos em restaurantes, ginásios, viagens, farmácias e muito mais;

One to one | valorizamos a comunicação aberta entre todos;

Celebrations | celebramos juntos perto ou longe e com prendas especiais;

Referral Program | programa de referência de colegas e amigos;

Stack | portátil, pacote de dados e kit de boas-vindas;

Diversity | Na Bee Engineering valorizamos a diversidade, defendemos a equidade e empenhamo-nos em criar um ambiente seguro, baseado no espírito de equipa e entreajuda. Estamos comprometidos em desenvolver práticas promotoras da igualdade de oportunidades e em combater a discriminação;

Sustainability & CSR | Enquanto empresa, temos um plano estratégico de ações definido, assente nos objetivos de desenvolvimento sustentável (Agenda 2030, ONU), com o objetivo de nos movermos de forma responsável e contribuirmos para um mundo mais sustentável e justo.

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
📌 We're Hiring: Senior Data Analyst | Porto (Hybrid)




Are you ready to take part in data-driven transformation within the Corporate & Investment Banking world? Join us as a Senior Data Analyst to support a major client on key finance and data management initiatives.




🔍 About the role

You will play a central role in improving data quality, reporting capabilities, and analytical frameworks that support decision-making across finance departments. Working closely with both business and IT teams, you’ll help ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and used to its fullest potential.




🎯 What you’ll do:

Analyze, clean, and structure data to support finance operations
Build and maintain BI dashboards and reports (Power BI, Tableau)
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify needs and propose automation solutions
Apply statistical models and advanced data techniques
Support IT-led initiatives by contributing to data architecture and governance
Promote best practices in data visualization and reporting




📚 Key Projects:

Financial data quality & integrity optimization
Cross-team data reporting improvements
Automation and visualization of finance indicators
Support regulatory and internal audit requirements through data




🔧 Technical Skills:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the banking sector, ideally within CIB
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, SQL, DAX, M, and Python
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data manipulation, and predictive analysis
Experience working on IT/data projects in a complex environment




🌐 Language Skills:

Fluency in English (mandatory)
Other languages are a plus




💡 Soft Skills:

Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail
Excellent communication skills across business and technical teams
Ability to formalize complex subjects clearly and concisely
Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced setting




🌍 Why join us?

Be part of a dynamic, multicultural team driving innovation and compliance
Work on impactful, large-scale transformation initiatives
Hybrid work model with a focus on work-life balance
Opportunities for growth within an international organization




If you're passionate about data, eager to work in a financial environment, and ready to take on a new challenge in Porto, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Customer Data Analyst.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.


Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks.

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.


Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
We like to solve problems, and we can’t go a day without looking for innovative solutions. Ytech is a technological start-up focused on IT and Telecommunications that operates in two main areas: national project development and remote international projects.




🚀 Ready to join us, Power BI Analyst?




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain effective and user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, seasonality, and data behaviors.
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Work independently with a proactive and problem-solving attitude.
Be available to travel internationally for short periods when required.




Main Technical Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
4+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills to present data-driven insights.
Good command of English (minimum B2 level – mandatory).
Fast learner with autonomy and initiative.




Nice to Have / Plus

Experience working alongside Engineering teams on ETL pipelines.
Programming knowledge in Python or R.
Solid understanding of SQL and VBA.
Experience with SSAS, SSIS, and Azure.
Previous exposure to the financial sector.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban).
Knowledge of French is a plus.




What makes us different

Our vision is to innovate and reinvent through technological services, promoting the success of our partners.
Our mission is to connect clients with highly specialized professionals and drive business forward.
Our culture is centred on people and their well-being, which allows us to attract and retain the best talent.







Join the Ytech team! Send your CV to ihilario@ytech.io
