Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Data&AI, que tem suportado milhares de clientes na evolução/criação das suas plataformas de dados, analítica e IA e, por isso, procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia será composto por vários desafios, dos quais podemos elencar alguns:

  • Desenho e implementação de Arquiteturas de Dados escaláveis utilizando tecnologias de ponta com um foco na Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS, Alibaba Cloud);
  • Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) grandes volumes de dados de diversas fontes para Datalakes e Data Warehouses;
  • Definição e implementação de processos para controlo e tratamento de dados (Data Quality, Profiling, Cleansing, Masking, entre outros);
  • Desenho e implementação de soluções real-time;
  • Colaborar com vários stakeholders em projetos nacionais e internacionais;
  • Colaborar com múltiplos colegas da rede Deloitte, tirando partido do conhecimento e projetos internacionais que já decorreram e que estão a decorrer;
  • Assumir gradualmente a coordenação de equipas técnicas e funcionais no âmbito de projetos de dados;
  • Propor novas ideias e criar provas de conceito para diferentes desafios.


Procuramos profissionais com algumas das valências abaixo:

  • Licenciatura/ Mestrado nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores, Matemática ou áreas similares;
  • Experiência profissional entre 1 e 6 anos em projetos de Data;
  • Conhecimento de processos de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL / NoSQL;
  • Experiência profissional em soluções ETL (exemplos: Azure Data Fabric, AWS Glue, FiveTran, DBT, Talend, Matillion, Databricks);
  • Conhecimentos em Python, PySpark;
  • Experiência em soluções da Data Visualization (exemplo: Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, Grafana, Qlik);
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional com Data Warehouses / Data Lakes / Data Lakehouses;
  • Conhecimento de soluções Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) orientadas a arquiteturas de dados distribuídos;
  • Valorizamos experiência profissional em soluções/tecnologias Real-time (exemplos, Kafka, Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Amazon Kinesis, Azure Data Stream, MongoDB, outras);
  • Valorizamos experiência previa em projetos com metodologias Agile;
  • Domínio da língua inglesa falado e escrito (obrigatório);
  • Valorizamos também profissionais que tenham conhecimentos de língua francesa e alemã.
  • Valorizamos certificações orientadas aos projetos de dados;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Boas capacidades de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal e trabalho em equipa;
  • Sentido de responsabilidade, sentido crítico, curiosidade.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos;
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos;
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização;
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências;
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga. Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, em plataformas tecnológicas de transformação organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na indústria de serviços financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências nalguma destas áreas em soluções tecnológicas – engenharia de software, cloud, integração de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunicações, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, então estás no lugar certo!

Sabe mais em www.deloitte.com/pt/careers .

Keywords : Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.




💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:







SENIOR DATA ENGINEER




⚙ What will you do?

1.Tech Lead

Privileged technical point of contact for the Product Owner and business sponsors
Ability to take data engineering responsibility of a data project
Listening skills and very good communication skills
Ability to manage technical debt (variable according to use cases)
Technical architect, lead design meetings and tech breakdowns
Ability to mentor, guide the work of a more junior Data Engineer




2.Data Ingestion & Processing:

Design and implement batch and real-time data ingestion pipelines.
Use Databricks (with PySpark) for big data processing tasks.
Use DBT to transform data.
Cleanse, transform, and enrich raw data to make it analytics ready.
Optimize queries and data processing for speed and cost efficiency.




3.Data Storage & Management:

Design and implement database schemas, tables, and views.
Optimize storage formats for querying, such as Parquet or Delta Lake.
Enforce data quality checks and data lineage documentation.
Implement partitioning, bucketing, and indexing strategies for efficient data retrieval.




4.Collaboration with data experts (data analyst, data scientists):

Work closely with data scientists to provide data in appropriate formats for machine learning and advanced analytics.
Collaborate with Platform Engineer teams to comply with Platform good practices and escalate common needs
Assist data analysts with SQL queries, views, and report generation.
Collaborate on the deployment of machine learning models to production.




5.Security & Compliance (with Azure security experts):

Implement role-based access controls and data encryption (at-rest and in-transit).
Comply with industry and organizational data standards, privacy regulations, and best practices.
Regularly audit data access and usage.




6.Infrastructure & Configuration (with Azure infrastructure experts):

Set up and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure.
Configure and optimize Azure Data Lake Storage, Blob Storage, and other Azure storage solutions.
Deploy and manage Databricks clusters for processing tasks.
Implement and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
Monitor and troubleshoot infrastructure-related issues.




7.Documentation & Training:

Onboard new team members, providing access and initial training on tools.
Create documentation and knowledge bases for data pipelines, best practices, and tooling.




8.Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with the latest advancements in data engineering technologies.
Propose and implement optimizations for current workflows and systems.
Proactively identify areas of improvement and automation.
Regularly update team on new features or changes in Azure, Databricks, or related technologies.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Engineering Master’s degree or PhD
5 years+ experience in a Data engineering role into large corporate organizations
Experience in a Data/AI environment into a Cloud ecosystem
Python & Data Manipulation experience (Panda libraries and Python ecosystem)
Familiar with Software Engineering Practices
Advanced SQL Skills and Database Management and Architecture
Data integration and Data modelling and ETL experience
Big Data Processing knowledge
Cloud Platforms & Azure Services proficiency
Performance Optimization skills:
Data Security & Compliance knowledge
DevOps & Automation experience
Monitoring & Troubleshooting familiarity
Leadership & Initiative
Empathy & Accountability
Communication & Collaboration
Problem Solving & Analytical Thinking
Attention to Detail
Adaptability & Continuous Learning

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;

Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.

Show more
HTML:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.


Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.


🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.


💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?


💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!


In the meantime, check the opportunity below:



SENIOR DATA ENGINEER


⚙ What will you do?

1.Tech Lead

  • Privileged technical point of contact for the Product Owner and business sponsors
  • Ability to take data engineering responsibility of a data project
  • Listening skills and very good communication skills
  • Ability to manage technical debt (variable according to use cases)
  • Technical architect, lead design meetings and tech breakdowns
  • Ability to mentor, guide the work of a more junior Data Engineer


2.Data Ingestion & Processing:

  • Design and implement batch and real-time data ingestion pipelines.
  • Use Databricks (with PySpark) for big data processing tasks.
  • Use DBT to transform data.
  • Cleanse, transform, and enrich raw data to make it analytics ready.
  • Optimize queries and data processing for speed and cost efficiency.


3.Data Storage & Management:

  • Design and implement database schemas, tables, and views.
  • Optimize storage formats for querying, such as Parquet or Delta Lake.
  • Enforce data quality checks and data lineage documentation.
  • Implement partitioning, bucketing, and indexing strategies for efficient data retrieval.


4.Collaboration with data experts (data analyst, data scientists):

  • Work closely with data scientists to provide data in appropriate formats for machine learning and advanced analytics.
  • Collaborate with Platform Engineer teams to comply with Platform good practices and escalate common needs
  • Assist data analysts with SQL queries, views, and report generation.
  • Collaborate on the deployment of machine learning models to production.


5.Security & Compliance (with Azure security experts):

  • Implement role-based access controls and data encryption (at-rest and in-transit).
  • Comply with industry and organizational data standards, privacy regulations, and best practices.
  • Regularly audit data access and usage.


6.Infrastructure & Configuration (with Azure infrastructure experts):

  • Set up and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure.
  • Configure and optimize Azure Data Lake Storage, Blob Storage, and other Azure storage solutions.
  • Deploy and manage Databricks clusters for processing tasks.
  • Implement and maintain data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot infrastructure-related issues.


7.Documentation & Training:

  • Onboard new team members, providing access and initial training on tools.
  • Create documentation and knowledge bases for data pipelines, best practices, and tooling.


8.Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in data engineering technologies.
  • Propose and implement optimizations for current workflows and systems.
  • Proactively identify areas of improvement and automation.
  • Regularly update team on new features or changes in Azure, Databricks, or related technologies.


🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

  • Engineering Master’s degree or PhD
  • 5 years+ experience in a Data engineering role into large corporate organizations
  • Experience in a Data/AI environment into a Cloud ecosystem
  • Python & Data Manipulation experience (Panda libraries and Python ecosystem)
  • Familiar with Software Engineering Practices
  • Advanced SQL Skills and Database Management and Architecture
  • Data integration and Data modelling and ETL experience
  • Big Data Processing knowledge
  • Cloud Platforms & Azure Services proficiency
  • Performance Optimization skills:
  • Data Security & Compliance knowledge
  • DevOps & Automation experience
  • Monitoring & Troubleshooting familiarity
  • Leadership & Initiative
  • Empathy & Accountability
  • Communication & Collaboration
  • Problem Solving & Analytical Thinking
  • Attention to Detail
  • Adaptability & Continuous Learning


🎉 What we have to offer you?

  • Hybrid working model;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Health & Life Insurance;
  • Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
  • Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
  • More than 6000 free online courses;
  • Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
  • Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
  • Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.


We are waiting for you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your main activies are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders.


Behavioral Skills

Profile and skills to success


Ability to synthetize/simplify: Expert
Communication skills - oral & written: Expert
Ability to deliver/Results driven: Expert


Transversal Skills


Analytical Ability: Expert
Ability to manage a project: Proficient


Business Skills


Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics - Business Analytics: Expert


Languages


English (Fluent)


Tools and Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT MICROSOFT SQL Server (Expert)


Experience, Academic Background & Other Qualifications

Field of Expertise


Data Analytics ([3 - 4] years)


Academic Background


Masters in Mathematics and Statistics
Masters in Information Technology and Computer Science


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Marketing Data Scientist.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop Data-Driven Insights: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights from large and diverse datasets across different European markets, driving strategic marketing decisions and commercial execution optimization.
Utilising ML methods (e.g supervised, unsupervised) on an Azure platform with languages such as Python, build and implement Predictive Models: Design, build, and deploy predictive and machine learning models to identify market trends, customer behaviour, and business process outcomes.
Analyze Multi-Channel Marketing Data: Integrate and analyze data from various marketing channels (e.g., transactional, firmographic, behavioral, digital data from advertising, social media, email campaigns) to assess performance, identify patterns, generate usable segmentations and recommend improvements to amplify future success of activities.
Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with marketing, sales, and data teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with business goals. Enable analysts to further work on data points and reach data-driven recommendations to support in strategic planning and decision-making processes.
Ensure compliance to the Machine Learning Lifecycle from Data gathering through to Deployment. Appropriate checks and balances along with sufficient validation steps should be incorporated to maintain Data Quality and Compliance (e.g. GDPR and internal data governance policies)


What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Advanced Data Analysis and Modeling: Proficiency in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with experience in coding with Python, R, and SQL along with a good knowledge of Databricks is important. Knowledge of tools like Power BI for translating data into insights is a benefit.
Experience with Marketing Analytics: Strong background in analyzing and interpreting marketing data, with knowledge of marketing metrics, customer segmentation, and business performance evaluation.
Multi-Channel Data Integration: Expertise in integrating and analyzing data from various sources, including digital marketing platforms, CRM systems, large transactional databases, to create in depth intelligent views of customer cohorts.
Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders, including creating detailed reports, visualizations, and presentations.
Cross-Cultural and Regional Awareness: Understanding of the nuances and variations in marketing practices and consumer behavior across different European markets, with the ability to adapt strategies to diverse regional needs.


What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Data Engineer Power BI
Description:
Match Profiler is an Information Systems consultant who has been working in the national and international market since 1999. We have multidisciplinary skills and IT know-how that allow us to contribute, optimize and progress with our clients.

We are currently recruiting, for integration in our internal team/client, professionals with the following profile:




Data Engineer PowerBI (+4 years of experience) (m/f) – Hybrid (Porto)




What do you need to have:

Hard Skills:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience with Power BI 4+ years;

• Analytical mindset, to analyze large amounts of data and identify patterns, trends, seasonality and other data behaviors

• Clearly communicate data insights, findings and results to internal and external stakeholders.

• Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)

• Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required




Nice to Have / Plus:

• Experience working with Engineering on ETL pipelines;

• Experience with programming languages such as Python or R;

• SQL and VBA

• SSAS, SSIS and Azure

• Previous experience on financial area.

• Knowledge in agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban)

• French




Soft Skills:

• Good communication

• Team spirit

• Proactivity

• Time management




What we can offer:

• Personalized support from your team

• Your manager will take into consideration your motivations and suggestions

• Victories will be celebrated together

• Your HR and Support Teams will always be available to help

• Constant feedback on your work

• A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies from numerous sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, well-being, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc)

• And, of course, many gatherings and social events




To respond to this opportunity, send us your CV to the following e-mail address rita.marques@m-profiler.pt

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


4/5 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.

Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams

  • Framework, planning and budgeting of work
  • Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
  • Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
  • Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
  • Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation

As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,

  • Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
  • Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
  • Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.

Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project

  • Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
  • Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
  • Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
  • Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.

Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE

  • Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
  • Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
  • Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data

Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team

  • Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
  • Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.

Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process

  • Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
  • Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
  • Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • 4/5 years of experience in same or related field
  • Data knowledge
  • Risk analysis
  • Culture Transformation Change Management
  • Process improvement
  • Project management
  • Active collaboration
  • Adaptability
  • English (mandatory): fluent
  • French (recommended): Operational

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎 We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx)




MAIN TASKS:




Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and solve business problems.
Translate business requirements into Alteryx workflows, collaborating with local and remote IT teams to process and make data available to users.
Develop workflows according to IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary to deliver data projects.
Maintain and evolve assets created during the projects.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Experience: 4+ years in data preparation and data reconciliation.

Technical Skills:

Strong experience with Alteryx (2+ years).
Proficient in SQL.
Experience with VBA.
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a similar field.

Communication & Soft Skills:

Good communication skills.
Proactive and able to work autonomously.
Strong interest in learning, improving processes, and helping others.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team and across locations.
Languages: Proficient in English.
Nice to have: Power BI experience, experience in the financial industry, knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban), and French language skills.




📍Hybrid Role in Porto!




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Customer Data Analyst.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.


Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks.

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.


Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
We like to solve problems, and we can’t go a day without looking for innovative solutions. Ytech is a technological start-up focused on IT and Telecommunications that operates in two main areas: national project development and remote international projects.




🚀 Ready to join us, Power BI Analyst?




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain effective and user-friendly Power BI dashboards and reports.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, seasonality, and data behaviors.
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Work independently with a proactive and problem-solving attitude.
Be available to travel internationally for short periods when required.




Main Technical Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related fields.
4+ years of hands-on experience with Power BI.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent communication skills to present data-driven insights.
Good command of English (minimum B2 level – mandatory).
Fast learner with autonomy and initiative.




Nice to Have / Plus

Experience working alongside Engineering teams on ETL pipelines.
Programming knowledge in Python or R.
Solid understanding of SQL and VBA.
Experience with SSAS, SSIS, and Azure.
Previous exposure to the financial sector.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Scrum/Kanban).
Knowledge of French is a plus.




What makes us different

Our vision is to innovate and reinvent through technological services, promoting the success of our partners.
Our mission is to connect clients with highly specialized professionals and drive business forward.
Our culture is centred on people and their well-being, which allows us to attract and retain the best talent.







Join the Ytech team! Send your CV to ihilario@ytech.io

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Descrição da Função

Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations. This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business. We are looking for a Data Analyst to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid). Requirements: -Between 3 to 6 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role; -Previous experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or in a similar senior role; -Strong knowledge of business intelligence methodologies, particularly in data visualization (must have); -Proficiency in Power BI and experience in developing and managing BI reports; -Advanced SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and performance tuning; -Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and modeling; -Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical methods to support data-driven decision-making; -Excellent communication (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly; -Good level of English (at least C1). We offer: - Health insurance; - A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary; - Constant feedback so you can grow professionally; - Remote onboarding process; - Team events every semester so you can live new adventures; - Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Localização


Porto, Portugal

Title: Market Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis is a French multinational financial services firm specialized in asset & wealth management, corporate & investment banking, insurance and payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France through its two retail banking networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d’Epargne, Natixis counts nearly 16,000 employees across 38 countries.

As Natixis Innovation Hub, Natixis in Portugal mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank’s business, operations and work culture, being a key driver of the company’s culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Job Description

Market Risk Department supervises all Market Risk and P&L indicators of Natixis Global Markets activities.

Market data Hub team mandate is centered around the quantitative daily control challenge, certifies and feeds FO systems with end of day Market Data across several asset classes (equity, rates, and FX). This process is done using an in-house dedicated application called MDM (Market Data Manager) which is used by the different international platforms (Paris, HK and NY).

Besides the daily production the analyst will be responsible to perform daily and monthly tasks related to market data controls on different asset classes (equity, rates, and FX) and update on the market data framework.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The analyst will intervene on risk factors and market data across FX, equity and Rates asset classes and will actively:


Help to produce presentations of results for internal committees with the senior management
Develop control and certification capacity by setting up and running proper quantitative and qualitative challenges to the current algorithm used when assessing market data external providers
Support Market data hub team in creating daily certifications tasks
Help replying to clients needs (CCA, Front office, Econometrics, MRM, etc) on daily basis
Maintain an efficient and clean market data framework


Analyst will work in close collaboration with multiples departments from Front Offices / FO Quants, to various market risk teams and other risk quantitative methodologies teams.

Qualifications


Advanced degree in computer science, data science or finance is a must
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and Java, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization libraries
Knowledge of interest rate, credit, fx, equity and commodity products and risk factors
+5 years Experience working in the financial services industry or a related field is a plus
Strong desire to learn and eager to make a meaningful impact in a dynamic and innovative environment
Programming skills, python, SQL, java
Proficient in data APIs
Knowledge on Natixis valuation systems: Summit, Polypaths, Sophis, Murex, among others is a plus
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Knowledge in financial products and financial market is required
English speaker is mandatory


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Data Science Analyst (Fashion)
Description:
Who We Are




We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS’ eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.




We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer




A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What you will do




Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.




What you’ll bring




1–2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)




Nice to have:




Experience in retail, fashion, or e-commerce industries.
Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Show more

Who We Are


We are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that develops and delivers solutions around Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing and Design and provides Advisory services. We have offices in 15 locations with a talent pool of 1000+ employees and more than 50 nationalities, dedicated to creating long-lasting impact and growth for our business partners and clients.

Together with HUGO BOSS, our esteemed business partner, we have embarked on a joint venture and created the HUGO BOSS Digital Campus, dedicated to increasing the data analytics, eCommerce and technology capabilities of the company and boosting digital sales. The HUGO BOSS Digital Campus employees will help create a state-of-the-art data architecture infrastructure, advanced business analytics, and the development and enhancement of HUGO BOSS’ eCommerce platform and services.

This collaborative environment will provide the capabilities required for HUGO BOSS to maximise data usage and support its growth trajectory towards becoming the leading premium tech-driven fashion platform worldwide.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

Title: Risk Data Analyst - RISK EM
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (“RISK MFI”) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (“GM”) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you’ll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.
